quote: Should a machine not function upon striking the panel marked "on" this is an omen of great ill. The reasons ascribed may be as follows. Firstly, the function of inadequate preparation on the part of the operator. Secondly, the action of the machine whose spirit may refuse the binding of the operator. Thirdly, the malintent of some third party upon the operator or machine. The operator must repeat the ritual from the beginning re-purifying himself, enscribing the runes, intoning the incantations, and striking the panel marked 'on'. An accompanying oath may be made. Should this procedure fail, the operator must recourse to consulting the instruction manual.
author: Runic Spaceflight - An Introduction: Naval Flight Manual W110E

quote:
Question: What has the Emperor ever done for me?
Answer: What have you ever done for the Emperor?
author: Training questions, Administration Cant and Dogma

quote: There is only the Emperor, and he is our Shield and Protector.
author: Statement of fact, Second Book of Chantings

quote: You gaze at the mountain, Children of Terra, you see its snow-capped peak and the clouds upon its slopes. You dream of reaching that pinnacle and drinking the cold waters. But who dreams of the road that ascends the mountain side? The road to the peak is hard and murderous. It has broken countless Children of Terra upon its rocks. Their splintered bones lie scattered upon it, paving the way to the mountain top. At every step you will hear the bones crumbling under foot, and maybe you shall hear the wind-blown voices of the dead - guiding you forward or leading you to your doom. Yes, my children, the way to the mountain is cruel and unforgiving. And of those who struggle their long lives, spending their energy and vigour in the climb, who then can taste the melt-water of the summit and say, 'Yes... yes it was worthwhile?'
author: Firing rite (old recension)

quote: Our thoughts light the Darkness that others may cross space. We are one with the Emperor, our souls are joined in his will. Praise the Emperor whose sacrifice is life as ours is death. Hail his name the Master of Humanity.
author: The Credo of the Astronomican

quote: My will be done
author: Codex Imperialis

quote: Those who scale the pinnacles of glory have the furthest to plunge into the abyss.
author: Melothrucius Lux
bookSource: Codex: Chaos Space Marines (8th Edition), pg. 12

quote: The Imperium! How mighty its aspect! How far-reaching its boundaries! As one world dies ten more are brought into the fold. Fear us, for we count the lives of planets, not men!
author: Cardinal Morius Blate, Ecclesiarch Primus

quote: A fortress is a living thing: the commander its brain, the walls its bones, the sensors its eyes and ears, the troops its blood, their weapons its fists. This tells us two things: If one organ fails, the whole dies. And if the whole dies, no single organ can survive alone.
author: Mordin Barr

quote: Contact with alien races always renews one's faith in humanity. It is my belief that foreign travel narrows the mind wonderfully.
author: Helem Boesch

quote: If all else fails: duck. As a defensive stratagem it's unreliable, but incredibly reassuring for a moment or two.
author: Lord Corvis of Petrax

quote: If you don't expect gratitude you'll seldom be disappointed.
author: Eyor Dedonki
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. Four, pg. 539

quote: The universe has many horrors yet to throw at us. This is not the end of our struggle. This is just the beginning of our crusade to save Humanity. Be faithful! Be strong! Be vigilant!
author: The Emperor of Mankind

quote:
To be Unclean
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Impure
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Abhorred
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Reviled
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Hunted
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Purged
This is the mark of the Mutant
To be Cleansed
This is the mark of the Mutants
author: First Book of Indocrinations

quote: It’s often remarked that diplomacy is just warfare by other means. Our battles are no less desperate for being bloodless, but at least we get wine and finger food.
author: Tollen Ferlang, Imperial Envoy to the Realm of Ultramar, 564-603.M41
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 4, pg. 83

quote: Never take a gamble you’re not prepared to lose.
author: Abdul Goldberg, Rogue Trader
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 14, pg. 225

quote: Shall we lie down meekly as a lamb before the ravening wolf or shall we oppose such horrors as the galaxy will throw at us with proud contempt? Suffer not the beasts and abominations of other worlds to live in our Imperium!
author: Orthas Gregoran, Chief Demagogue of the Forlan Synod

quote: Give me a squad of marines first. But second, give me army troops and a solid wall.
author: Commander Ashton Grimes

quote: The warp is a vital tool to us, a means of communication and transport. Without it, there would be no Imperium of Man, for there would be no quick bridges between the stars. We use it, and we harness it, but we have no absolute control over it. It is a wild thing that tolerates our presence, but brooks no mastery. There is power in the warp, fundamental power, not good, nor evil, but elemental and anathema to us. It is a tool we use at our own risk.
author: Warmaster Horus
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 10, pg. 198

quote: Earth is the hub of the Imperium. It's the centre of government, the setting of mankind's greatest temples, the home of our wealthiest and most powerful merchant houses. And the most corrupt.... where there is government and where there is money, there is corruption. And there is no place in this universe that has more government and more money than Old Earth.
author: Ranek Icewalker, Wolf Priest of the Space Wolves

quote: You ask me how, for example, I would deal with a fortress. What can I say? Blast it? Burn it? Gas it? The list is endless. But the military man should never raise such questions. From the moment he enters the Chapter he is taught to deal with practicalities. What is the objective - capture or destroy? What troops do I have - Space Marines or native planet regulars? How are they equipped? What is known of the defenders? And so on. A military man avoids open questions, and resists himself to facts. This is a crucial difference; a question requires an answer, a set of facts has only a result. An answer raises further questions, but a result is indisputable.
author: Imperial Commander Ryland Kline

quote: One cannot consider the fate of a single man, nor ten, nor a thousand. Billions will live or die by our actions here, and we have not the luxury to count the cost.
author: Inquisitor Kryptman

quote: Revenge is a dish best served with mayonnaise and those little cheesy things on sticks.
author: Osric the Loopy, Governor of Corania
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 21, pg. 753

quote: If your battle plan's working, it's probably a trap.
author: Kolton Phae
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium, ch. 13, pg. 649

quote: The past is always with us.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 19, pg. 735

quote: If you go looking for trouble, you're sure to find it.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 17, pg. 705

quote: Life’s so much easier when you’ve got someone to blame.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 16, pg. 257

quote: The gratitude of the powerful is a heavy weight to bear.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 7, pg. 123

quote: Old friends are like debt collectors; they have a tendency to turn up when you least expect them.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 3, pg. 65

quote: One thing you can say for enemies; they make life more interesting.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 2, pg. 513

quote: Paranoia is a very comforting state of mind. If you think they're out to get you, it means you think you matter.
author: Gilbran Quail, Collected Essays
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 6, pg. 563

quote: Through the needle's eye, I live or die.
author: Scholastia Psykana saying

quote: War is hell.
author: William Tekumsah Sherman, ancient Terran general
bookSource: Fear to Tread (Novel), page after Dramatis Personae

quote: The wider he smiled and called us friend, the tighter we clung to our purses.
author: Argun Slyter
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 1, pg. 501

quote: Life's a journey. Shame about the destination.
author: Argun Slyter
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 16, pg. 697

quote: The distinction between Trade and Warfare is seen only by those who have no experience of either.
author: Heironymo Sondar, High Master of Vervunhive

quote: Beautiful on the surface, but rotten underneath. Don't ever, even for a second, doubt that this is the most dangerous world in the galaxy.... Danger does not always come in the shape of orks with bolters, Ragnar. This world is where the elite of the Imperium have gathered. We are talking now of the most ruthless, ambitious, unscrupulous collection of rogues ever culled from a million planets. This is the place they have come to realise their ambitions, and on Terra they can, and will not let anything stand in their way. Not me, not you, not their own kin if need be.
author: Torin, Wolfblade to House Belisarius

quote: But do not underestimate them. The Navigators are, for the most part, as clever as they think they are. They would not survive otherwise. They are born and trained to conspiracy as we are born and trained to war.
author: Torin, Wolfblade to House Belisarius

quote: Stories are much tidier than real life. Stories have neat, happy endings, but all you ever really get is unfinished business.
author: Janni Vakonz, holo director
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), Epilogue, pg. 267

quote: You can never have too many enemies. The more you've got, the more likely they are to get in each other's way.
author: Jarvin Wallankot
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 15, pg. 675

quote: Look to your battle-gear and it will protect you We guard it with out lives Your armour is your Soul, and your Soul's dedication its armour The soul of a warrior is the shield of humanity Honour the craft of death Only the Emperor is higher in our devotion Honour the battle-gear of the Dead We ask only to serve
author: Warrior's Catechism of Worship (part)

quote: In my high seat I gaze into the immaterium and see the shadow that our own universe casts into depthlessness. This eye... this eye sees gentle flows of soul-stuff where the becalmed mind might starve to death, and tides and churns of genius and hate. The warp mocks the power of words to describe. But what I can never turn my back on is the power and the beauty of the Emperor. I see His soul shine out from Earth and His presence fill every corner of the immaterium. I am scorned for what I talk of seeing, scorned by my family - so be it. Some say that every one of us sees a face of the warp meant only for him, a warp that none other shall ever see, but it makes no matter. I have known from the first time I beheld it that I could do nothing but follow that light with my life.
author: Peshto Vask Zemlya, Navigator

quote: Do not neglect the defence of gateways. They must be able to bar entry as well as allowing it.
Do not waste your tears. I was not born to watch the world grow dim. Life is not measured in years, but by the deeds of men.
Every man is a spark in the darkness. by the time he is noticed he is gone forever. A retinal after-image that fades and is obscured by newer, brighter lights.
For every battle honour, a thousand heroes die alone, unsung, and unremembered.
If a job's worth doing it's worth dying for.
In an Imperium of a million worlds, what matters the loss of one? That depends very much on the world.
It is not my mind to ask questions that cannot be answered. That is the soul standing upon the crossroad of vacillation. You search for wisdom, but achieve only a stasis of will.
Let the strength of your will match the stone of your walls.
Only in your deepest self is the truth of what you can be. And, without a doubt, that truth is terrible to bear.
Praise the sun that brings the dawn of our final doom.
Speed the bolt that brings the end of enemy and friend.
Success is commemorated; Failure merely remembered.
The greatest man is but a ripple on the surface of space.
There is no right or wrong in our profession. The present changes the past from moment to moment. Only pray for the future to vindicate your action.
Walk softly and carry a big Multi-melta.

Weigh the fist that strikes men down
And salutes the battle won.

We shall carry our word,
We will correct and unify,
Hail the Emperor!
What fear of death have we who know there is immortality in the great and noble deeds of men?
Wisdom is the beginning of fear.

Remember that it is the duty of the mighty Adeptus Astartes Chapters and the glorious Imperial Guard to wage the Emperor's wars and the duty of the fearless Imperial Navy to guard the Emperor's spaceways, but it is to his loyal servants the Adeptus Arbites that His Divine Majesty in His infinite wisdom entrusts the most sacred duty of all - Keeping in check the lawless heretic rabble that passes itself off as the Emperor's worthy subjects.
author: Adeptus Arbites

quote: To serve the Emperor. To protect His domains. To judge and stand guard over His subjects. To carry the Emperor's law to all worlds under His blessed protection. To pursue and punish those who trespassed against His word.
author: Adeptus Arbites

quote: Well he's not getting mine.
author: Praetor Kolbe
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 16, pg. 700

quote: No servant of the Emperor dies unavenged. No enemy of the Emperor escapes unpunished!
author: Promise of the Pax Imperialis

quote: To be just, our law must be cruel.
Praise the Emperor! The Emperor's word is the Law, and the Arbites are the voice by which that word is spoken!
To stand upon the bedrock of the Law is our great duty. To presume to stand above it is our worst heresy.

The "Overlord Instinct" or the "I'm the King of the Castle" syndrome works in our favour when we crush rebellions. The traitors are safe and sound behind their fortress walls. We, the loyal servants of Our Emperor, need look no further for our targets.
author: Johannes Dixen

quote: Pain is an illusion of the senses, despair an illusion of the mind.
author: Assassin proverb

quote: For those that defy the Imperium, only the Emperor can judge your crimes. Only in death can you receive the Emperor's Judgement.
author: Motto of the Officio Assassinorum
bookSource: Codex: Assassins (2nd Edition), pg. 2, Eternal Damnation (Graphic Novel), Short Story The Ionis Gambit

quote: We do not determine the guilty; we do not decide the punishment; we are merely the cold intrument of the Emperor's vengeance. There is no form of death unknown to us; there is no form of terror beyond our means; there is no enemy outside our reach. We are the blade that hovers over the throat of the traitor; we are the bullet that awaits the heretic's skull; we are the poison in the throat of the alien.
author: Decree Assassinorum

quote: We are the killing tools of the Imperium, we live to honor the Callidus temple and die to serve the Emperor.
author: Dictatus Callidus

quote: To assume the shape of the accursed and deliver death from the purity within you - that is to be Callidus.
author: Dictatus Callidus

quote: Treachery is its own reward.
author: Callidus Temple proverb

quote: That which is unknown and unseen always commands the greatest fear.
author: Motto of the Culexus Temple

quote: Sow the seeds of damnation and I shall reap the souls of the tainted.
author: Eversor Temple, Modus Executus

quote: Fear me, for I am your apocalypse.
author: Modus Executus

quote:
Exitus Acta Probat:
The Outcome Justifies The Deed.
author: Motto of the Vindicare Temple
bookSource: Codex: Assassins (2nd Edition), pg. 11, Eternal Damnation (Graphic Novel) Short Story The Samos Sanction

quote: Three things matter in marksmanship - location, location, location.
author: Training Dogma, Vindicare Temple

quote:
All of the worlds of the Imperium shall look to their own defense. They shall also look to the defense of the Imperium, and the prosecution of such wars as the Emperor in His wisdom shall decree.
Therefore, each populated planet shall raise and maintain its own planetary defense force, and from the ranks of this defense force it shall provide the best of its troops for recruitment into the Imperial Guard, according to such requirements as shall be imposed by the Administratum.
author: from the Introit to the Codex Exercitus

quote: Statistically, you will almost certainly die when assaulting a well-maintained fortress with a competent commander. You must strive to make your death useful.
author: Training Manual, Penal Legion, Suicide Bomb Squads

quote: Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst.
author: Imperial Guard Tactical Manual
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 8, pg. 591

quote:
Victory is achieved through mettle.
Glory is achieved through metal.
author: Uttica 1st Tank Company motto
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 65

quote: Be swift and silent - as the breeze that crosses the dunes without stirring a grain of sand.
author: Captain Al'rahem, Tallarn 3rd 'Desert Tigers'

quote: If you want a textbook example of righteous hatred, you need look no further than Commissar Yarrick. In him we see a man who justly despises his foes, and they in turn loath him.
author: Lecturer-General Aldous, Scholam Progena
bookSource: Games Workshop: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Hatred - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: Fifth Company, this is the moment of truth. You will not fear. You will not falter. You will not give a single step to the enemy.
author: Governor-Militant Lukas Alexander, Commander 1st Kronus Regiment
bookSource: Dawn of War: Dark Crusade (Imperial Guard stronghold campaign)

quote: Enemies of the Imperium, hear me. You have come here to die. The Immortal Emperor is with us and we are invincible. His soldiers will strike you down. His war machines will crush you under their treads. His mighty guns will bring the very sky crashing down upon you. You cannot win. The Emperor has given us his greatest weapon to wield. So make yourselves ready. We are the First Kronus Regiment, and today is our Victory Day.
author: Governor-Militant Lukas Alexander, Commander 1st Kronus Regiment
bookSource: Dawn of War: Dark Crusade (Imperial Guard stronghold campaign)

quote: When the people forget their duty they are no longer human and become something less than beasts. They have no place in the bosom of humanity nor in the heart of the Emperor. Let them die and be forgotten.
author: Leto Barbaden, Governor of Salinas
bookSource: The Killing Ground (Novel), ch. 20; Codex Imperialis (Background Book), pg. 10

quote: A good soldier obeys without question. A good officer commands without doubt.
author: Sergeant Lukas Bastonne, Cadian Shock Troopers

quote: Blessed is the mind too small for doubt.
author: Commissar Groden Bevro

quote: I left my homeworld the night it died, and I've been fighting for its memory ever since. We Tanith are a dying breed. There are only about twenty hundred of us left. Gaunt only got away with enough for one regiment. The Tanith First. The First-and-Only. That's what makes us 'Ghosts', you see. The last few unquiet souls of a dead world. And I suppose we'll keep going until we're all done.
author: Trooper Dermon Caffran, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: First and Only (Novel), Part Three: Fortis Binary Forge World, ch. Six

quote: Sorry. I prefer blondes.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: I thought the acolytes of Khorne were supposed to be warriors, not a bunch of pansies.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: The noncom in charge of the squad must have been on something, I thought. Nobody spoke like that outside badly-written combat novels.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: Frak this, for my faith is a shield proof against your blandishments!
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: Frak this! My soul's my own and I'm keeping it!
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: Well then, I seem to recall a rather pleasant little restaurant not far from here. Care to see if it's still standing?
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: As I try to impress on the young whelps in my charge these days, it isn't the scarlet sash and the fancy hat that makes you a commissar, it's the way you wear them. The troops you serve with are never going to like you, but if you can get them to respect you that can be almost as good. Remember, you're going to spend most of your career on a battlefield with them, and they've all got guns, so making them think you're a liability is never going to be a very good idea.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: I've come across a number of planetary governors in the course of my erratic progress around the galaxy and, on the whole, the ones who weren't incompetent were either corrupt, insane, or both; on at least one occasion sufficiently so to have mortgaged their soul and the world they administered to the forces of the Ruinous Powers.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain
bookSource: Traitor's Gambit (Chapbook) UK Games Day 2009, pg. 6

quote: I'd faced the servants of the Great Enemy more often than I cared to contemplate, and in my experience it was never wise to underestimate them. Particularly a ten thousand year old madman, who'd been marinating himself in the raw stuff of Chaos for most of that time.
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain

quote: What do I ask of my officers? Merely that they do their duty with fire in their bellies and a prayer on their lips.
author: Lord Castellan Ursarkar E. Creed
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 2nd Codex), pg. 50

quote: Although all documents surrounding the final fate of the original Mordant 13th - the "Lucky 13s" - have been sealed by order of the Inquisition, I, on behalf of the Cadian High Command, order another regiment to be mustered and given the name “The Mordant 13th”. The psyker cadre that advises my High Command have divined, through the Emperor’s Tarot, that just such a regiment will be able to protect the Imperium from all of its foes. It is with all haste that this regiment be raised and trained. We need these men to be hardened fighters in the service of the Emperor before the year is out.
author: Lord Castellan Ursarkar E. Creed
bookSource: Games Workshop: The Lucky 13s (saved archive page, dated 12 January 2008, last accessed 11 December 2022)

quote: Though our tanks and artillery are mighty, it is the vast ranks of Imperial Guardsmen that shall trample the enemy to dust - let them come.
author: Lord Castellan Ursarkar E. Creed
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (5th Edition), Back cover

quote: Children you call them? They can pull a trigger just as well as veterans, and they have the spirit of a bull narthax. Call them children if you wish - I call them troops.
author: Colonel Marus Cullen, Pannonia 5th Infantry Regiment

quote: The Valhallans hate the cold as much as the rest of us, they're just taught that carpin' on about it gets the Commissars all riled...
author: Mosstrooper "Reiv" Daggat of the 17th Drookian Fenguard

quote: Da Sergeant Major asked me what my job was an' I said it was to, uh, do what I was told. He said I was a genius and gave me another medal. I likes da Imperial Guard!
author: Nork Deddog, Ogryn Bodyguard

quote: I have at my command an entire battle group of the Imperial Guard. Fifty regiments, including specialized drop troops, stealthers, mechanized formations, armored companies, combat engineers and mobile artillery. Over half a million fighting men and thirty thousand tanks and artillery pieces are mine to command. Emperor show mercy to the fool that stands against me, for I shall not.
author: Warmaster Demetrius
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (5th Edition), pg. 7 Imperial Armour Volume One - Imperial Guard and Imperial Navy, pg. 159

quote: It remains a sad truth of the Imperium that virtually no veteran ever comes back from fighting its wars intact. Combat alone shreds nerves and shatters bodies. But the horrors of the warp, and of foul xenos forms like the tyranid, steal sanity forever, and leave veterans fearing the shadows, and the night and, sometimes, the nature of their friends and neighbours, for the rest of their lives.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: Ogryns. If we time it just right, the Eldar will all be going "What the..." just when what's left of the Company breaks cover over here and piles into them. No spreading out, no fancy stuff, just smash through. Let's see how those degenerate sophisticates handle a healthy dose of pure unreasoning violence.
author: Commander Fleyitch

quote: Men of Tanith! Do you want to live forever?
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: First and Only (Novel), Part Two: Fortis Binary Forge World, ch. 3

quote: I am a Commissar. I am empowered to deliver justice wher ever I see it lacking. I am empowered to punish cowardice. I am granted the gift of total authority to judge, in the name of the Emperor, on the field of combat.
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: First and Only (Novel), A Memory: Khedd 1173

quote: I don't pretend to understand the technology, but I know that's an intact Standard Template weapons maker. And I know that's as unheard of as a well-manicured ork.
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: First and Only (Novel), Part Six: Menazoid Epsilon, ch. 23

quote: Give any man the power of a god, and you better hope he's got the wisdom and morals of a god to match. There's nothing feeble about my moral line. I value life. That is why I fight to protect it. I mourn every man I lose and every sacrifice I make. One life or a billion, they're all lives.
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: First and Only (Novel), Part Six: Menazoid Epsilon, ch. 23

quote: I have a reputation, Modile, a reputation as a fair, honest man who treats his soldiers well and supports them in the face of darkness. Potentially, that reputation makes me soft. It seems I understand failure and forgive it. Some, like Kowle, believe me to be a weak commissar, not prepared to take the action my rank demands. Not prepared to enforce field discipline where I see it failing. I am an Imperial commissar. I will enflame the weak, support the wavering, guide the lost. I will be all things to all men who need me. But I will also punish without hesitation the incompetent, the cowardly, and the treasonous.
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only

quote: Choose, for courtesy's sake, summary execution or a firing squad of your own men.
author: Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only

quote: If you will not serve in combat, then you will serve on the firing line.
author: Commissar Anton Gebbet, 1st Kronus Regiment

quote: I have seen war in all its forms. I have seen feral world savages braining each other with stones, and I have monitored the death of a whole planet at the hands of a virus bomb. I have seen Space Marines drop to certain death, and win. I have seen Titans crush whole platoons underfoot. But there is no more stirring sight in war than the charge of massed cavalry.
author: Dravin Gratz, 14th Tharinga Regiment, Imperial Guard

quote: Target and deny! By our deaths shall they know us!
author: General Coron Grizmund, Narmenian Armoured

quote: Let's give them hell, men.
author: General Coron Grizmund, Narmenian Armoured

quote: One hammer blow will be all it takes. Place the men on alert, summon the reserves! We crush them here and now, for the Emperor!
author: Graf Harazahn, Lord Marshal
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Apocalyptic Battle – Major Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 7 October 2015)

quote: Back home, I once fancied me a pair of Catachan Devil boots. Killed me half a dozen of the great ugly critters but never found a single one that wore any!
author: Gunnery Sergeant "Stonetooth" Harker

quote: Been on a death world once. That was a bit like home. Most places are better, though. And there's regular rations. We get more if the Emperor's really pleased with us.
author: Sergeant-Ogryn Hrathlagg

quote: Stupid dumb Orks, don’t they know they’re on our territory now? Kyraxian Death-jungle? Feels just like home to me!
author: Jarn “Bullneck” Colda, Captain Catachan IX
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Home Ground - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: Ugh! What happened to these guys! Looks like they've been sliced and diced.
author: Private Joanus Finks
bookSource: Imperial Armour II - Ork, Eldar and Dark Eldar Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 13

quote: Marching through this green hellhole, getting slowly eaten by flies, drowning in our own sweat and choking on sulfur fumes? I can’t see why that’s not a good idea.
author: Lieutenant Kage, 13th Penal Legion

quote: Of course they’d come to Mordant for the saviors of the galaxy! We’re the hardest gakking troopers you’ll find in all the Segmentums! I’m proud to lead these warriors of the Emperor where ever he needs us to fight. We’ll stand fast against the myriad of foes that batter at the gates of the Imperium. I’ve scoured the mines and shanty-towns for the fiercest low-lives I could find. As I speak to you now, my men are already suffering through the most rigorous boot camp you could imagine. No soldier of the Lucky 13s will be grist for the mill.
author: Colonel Jago Kallowen
bookSource: ames Workshop: The Lucky 13s (saved archive page, dated 12 January 2008, last accessed 12 December 2022)

quote: It is not enough that I achieve victory - my enemy must suffer total defeat. It is not enough that I kill - all my foes must die. It is not enough that I succeed - all others must fail!
author: Mogul Kamir

quote: I don’t know what effect they have on the enemy, but by the Emperor, they frighten me.
author: General Karis
bookSource: For The Emperor (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 1, pg. 35

quote: Trust? Trust’s got nothing to do with it. I just don’t want them out of my sight.
author: General Karis
bookSource: For The Emperor (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 10, pg. 167

quote: I don't care how bloody sanctioned they are, a psyker's a psyker, and anything to do with the warp is more trouble than it's worth.
author: General Karis
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 11, pg. 625

quote: We hit ‘em so hard half of them were still squatting on their latrines. Ain’t nothing in the galaxy that brings victory half as sure as killing the enemy before he knows he’s in a fight.
author: Kol ‘Gutting Knife’ Freen, Penal Legionnaire
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Surprise Attack - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: We're the Death Korps of Krieg, son. Did you think that was just a pretty name? We never retreat. We fight and we die, that's the Krieg way.
author: Lieutenant Konarski, 933rd Death Korp of Krieg
bookSource: Warriors of Ultramar (Novel) - The Ultramarines Omnibus, ch. 11, pg. 440

quote:
Weep for him - for his faith was not sufficient.
Rejoice for yourselves, for my faith is bottomless!
Forward, for the Emperor!
author: Commissar Krieglust
bookSource: Warhammer 40,000: Compendium, pg. 151; Codex: Imperial Guard (5th Edition), pg. 10

quote: And the heretic priests of Eidoline came forth, bringing false images for the praise of the lost people.
author: Kronin
bookSource: 13th Legion (Novel) - The Last Chancers (Omnibus), ch. Seven, pg. 208

quote: And they smote the enemies of the Emperor with a righteous fury, for they knew they were doing His work.
author: Kronin
bookSource: 13th Legion (Novel) - The Last Chancers (Omnibus), ch. Four, pg. 144

quote: We ride like the wind, my brothers – victory depends on it.
author: Kudubai Khan, Attilan Rough Rider
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Forced March - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 5 October 2015)

quote: No, he was not a Saint. He was a man. A very great man, and in many ways a very wicked one.
author: Veteran Sergeant Leo Lemuel

quote: With this act we have richly denied the Darkness and made trophies of its creatures. A dark lord is dead. So, this holy crusade, blessed by the Emperor, is advanced with glory.
author: Warmaster Macaroth
bookSource: The Sabbat Worlds Crusade (Background Book), pg. 17

quote: What is the strongest weapon of mankind? The god-machines of the Adeptus Mechanicus? No! The Astartes Legions? No! The tank? The lasgun? The fist? Not at all! Courage and courage alone stands above them all!
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius

quote: I give men dreams and men are led by their dreams.
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 2nd Codex), pg. 9

quote: What I cannot crush with words I will crush with the tanks of the Imperial Guard!
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius

quote: Peace? There cannot be peace in these times.
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 2nd Codex), pg. 23, Codex: Imperial Guard (5th Edition), pg. 6

quote: The meaning of victory is not to merely defeat your enemy but to destroy him, to completely eradicate him from living memory, to leave no remnant of his endeavours, to crush utterly his achievement and remove from all record his every trace of existence. From that defeat no enemy can ever recover. That is the meaning of victory.
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (5th Edition), pg. 13; The Killing Ground (Novel), ch. Fourteen, pg. 216

quote: Always endeavour to fight the enemy on your own terms. If you outnumber the foe use reserves to break through when the enemy's overstretched lines collapse. If you are outnumbered then concentrate your forces so that the enemy can fight only your best troops. If you are powerful at close quarters then engage in dense terrain where your advantage will prove greatest. If you are superior at long range then attack along an extended front. Remember always, however, that a commander who puts his faith in heavy weaponry will be easily outmaneuvered and a commander who relies on close combat without adequate support will lose his force to disciplined fire. No one has ever won a battle who failed to take advantage of his enemy's weakness, or take heed of his own.
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius

quote: You ask me when this great and noble work of ours will be done? I tell you, it will have its end only when we have divided every sentient thing in this vast and wide cosmos into one of two separate and primary orders of being: the Righteous and the Dead.
author: Lord Commander Solar Macharius

quote: Where the hell are those throne-damned reinforcements? Get Kendrick on the vox. What do you mean there’s no signal? What in hell’s going on here?
author: Macros Captain, Mordian IV
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Disruptor Field - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: Doing the work of the Emperor is its own reward. But this is quite satisfying.
author: Sergeant Alem Mahat, 229th Tallarn Desert Raiders
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 19, pg. 741

quote: You can waste as many Imperial Guard lives as you care, that’s your stupidity and not my responsibility.
author: Warmaster Menitus
bookSource: 13th Legion (Novel) - The Last Chancers (Omnibus), Interlude between ch.s Four and Five, pg. 148

quote: I'd check my instruments if I were you. No-one in his right mind would lay a minefield in a place like...
author: Captain Forgus Merd

quote: I had heard many rumours of the horrors of the mysterious Eldar. Of fire-clad daemons no weapons could harm. Of power-wreathed psykers who can tell your forture and forecast your doom. Of winged warriors falling from the sky like rain and tall guardian warriors powered by the spirits of the dead. None concerned me. None held any terror for a faithful servant of the Emperor with the might of the Imperial Guard at his command. Non save their aircraft. When fighting the Eldar, watch the skies...
author: Morcar, Lord Commander

quote: Peace is not in my vocabulary.
author: Jarra Mordiker Commander, 13th/5th Support Regiment

quote: They may spend every off-duty minute polishing their shiny boots and marching up and down the parade ground in perfect formation, but don't let that fool you. These men are steel-eyed, cold-blooded killers and I'd as soon have a platoon of them in my force as I would a company of other troops.
author: Gharan O'Hen, Army 212 Chief of Staff

quote: Winning is everything, but the trick is to know where the winning really is.... We're political animals, Ibram. Through us, if we do our job properly, the black and white of war is tempered. We are the interpreters of combat, the translators. We give meaning to war, subtlety, purpose even. Killing is the most abhorrent, mindless profession known to man. Our role is to fashion the killing machine of the human species into a positive force. For the Emperor's sake. For the sake of our own consciences.
author: Commissar-General Delane Oktar
bookSource: First and Only (Novel) - Gaunt's Ghosts: The Founding (Omnibus), A Memory: Darendara, pg. 233

quote: The first trick a political officer of the Commissariat learns is: learn to lie. The second is: trust no one. The third: never get involved with local politics.
author: Commissar-General Delane Oktar

quote: Always, always lead from the front. Never expect a man under your command to undertake an action you're not prepared to make yourself.
author: Commissar-General Delane Oktar

quote: Target sighted! Red Corsairs Predator left of the bunker. See the repair seam on the turret? Steady. Fire! Good shot. Driver, AT mines, steer left now. Gunner! Enemy infantry in crater, eleven o'clock. High explosive, fire! Sponson gunners keep an eye out, there's plenty more where they came from...
author: Knight Commander Pask, Cadian 423rd Armoured Regiment

quote: Your foe is well equipped, well-trained, battle-hardened. He believes his gods are on his side. Let him believe what he will. We have the tanks on ours.
author: Colonel Joachim Pfeiff, Krieg 14th Armoured Regiment
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 31

quote: Codicier Pryke raised the point that a significant credit value was attached to this installation, and that its destruction would result in a 0.017 per cent fluctuation in the mean commerce averages of the sector. She went on to suggest that an alternative strategy should be found. Colonel Kasteen said she was welcome to go outside and ask the Orks to go away if she thought that would help.
author: Scrivener Quintus
bookSource: Caves of Ice (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), Editorial Note after ch. Five, pgs. 348–349

quote: Gaunt? He’s a despicable bastard who left my world to die and one day I will slay him with my own hands.
author: Major Elim Rawne, Tanith First and Only
bookSource: Ghostmaker (Novel) - Gaunt's Ghosts: The Founding (Omnibus), ch. Two, pg. 271

quote: A friend of death, a brother of luck and a son of a bitch.
author: Major Elim Rawne, Tanith First and Only

quote: We've run into scorpions the size of battle tanks, three men died from Eyerot last week. I've sweat enough to fill a lake, my boots got sucked into a sink-swamp and the trees are so thick in places, you can't squeeze between them. Emperor help me, I love this place! It's just like home!
author: Captain Rock of the Catachan III 'Green Devils'

quote: Sir, will do. I've never liked that particular title. It seems to foster unhealthy ambitions.
author: Colonel Rorkins, Imperial Guard (retired)
bookSource: Cain's Last Stand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Defender of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 9, pg. 605

quote: They’re sending us where? The want us to fight who? Well, I guess the Emperor knows what he’s doing, because those bureaucrats in the Administratum sure as gak don’t!
author: Trooper Gage Rorsche, 3rd Platoon, Alpha Company, Mordant 13th, "The Lucky 13s"
bookSource: Games Workshop: The Lucky 13s (saved archive page, dated 12 January 2008, last accessed 11 December 2022)

quote: They have seen more death and ruin than another soldier sees in ten lifetimes.
author: General Sejanus
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex), pg. 23

quote: I love the smell of promethium in the morning.
author: Captain Shambas, Valhallan 597th
bookSource: For The Emperor (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), pg. 212 (Editorial Note following ch. 12)

quote: In war, best know what enemies are around you in your camp, before you step out to face the foe and wonder why you do so alone.
author: Warmaster Slaydo

quote: Do not ask how you may give your life for the Emperor. Ask instead how you may give your death.
author: Warmaster Slaydo

quote: Never!
author: Warmaster Slaydo

quote: We have been given our crusade, my sons... the Sabbat Worlds!
author: Warmaster Slaydo

quote: The beati was a warrior. She exemplifies the Imperial creed, and the human spirit better than any figure in the annals. As a boy, she inspired me. I take this crusade as a personal matter, a duty greater than any I have yet undertaken for the Golden Throne. To repay her inspiration, to walk in her path and make free again the worlds she brought from darkness. I feel as if I am... a pilgrim, Ibram.
author: Warmaster Slaydo

quote: Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.
author: Imperial Warmaster Solon

quote: Damn it, follow me. I'll show you how it's done.
author: Colonel "Iron Hand" Straken, Catachan II

quote: To each of us falls a task. And all the Emperor requires of us Guardsmen is that we stand in line, and we die fighting. It is what we do best: we die standing.
author: General Sturnn, Commander Cadian 412th

quote: Although the Golden Throne of Terra orbits a distant star far from here, the Emperor's hand is on your shoulders today. You have fought and displayed bravery and loyalty far and above your calling as Guardsmen. You have faced the full brunt of an Ork Waaagh! as well as stared down the horrors of the Warp in the fallen Space Marines, and in that I am honoured to have led you.
author: General Sturnn, Commander Cadian 412th

quote: Oh. Were there Tyranids on Corania? I guess I was just too busy with my needlepoint to notice!
author: Lady General Jenit Sulla
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 2, pg. 50

quote: For justice! For vengeance! For the Emperor!
author: Lady General Jenit Sulla
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), Editorial Note after ch. 15, pg. 255

quote: The most dangerous thing on the battlefield is a junior officer with a compass and a map.
author: Lady General Jenit Sulla
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 7, pg. 573

quote: Walls of stone do not a fortress make. But they're not a bad start.
author: Commander Rango Thaxx

quote: We shall wage this war with undaunted faith and courage. We shall not take one step back. This is the Emperor's world and we will not surrender it!
author: Lord Marshal Toshenko

quote: A small mind is easily filled with faith.
author: Commissar Exen Treuer, 23rd Moradia Regiment

quote: It is always better to find your enemy, before your enemy finds you.
author: Commander Tulathan, Vastadt 4th Independent Tank Regiment
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 27

quote: All men need something to fight for, a cause to believe in. Tell them that the Emperor needs them to hold that ground at all costs, and they’ll fight like lions.
author: Commissar Tyreen, Versimmon Dragoons
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Capture and Secure - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive pg., dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: What I remember most about the battle for Vogen was the confusion and the colossal scale of death. We fought like heroes, like each building that had even one Guardsman inside was a fortress against the enemy. Every soldier, fighting in a basement or under the stairs, stood his ground alone and accomplished the task on his own. Because in cityfighting a soldier has to be his own general. He needs to be given correct guidance and the trust of his officers. On Vogen we had neither and how we survived was a miracle.
author: Veteran Sergeant Hessel, 122nd Cadians
bookSource: GW saved archive pg. of the introduction to Cityfight (last accessed 29 June 2015)

quote: I don’t get it. How does a tank that big just disappear? What sorcery can do… Holy Throne! Heavy weapons, right flank, right flank! Fire now.
author: Corporal Webb, Cadian XIV Shocktroopers
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Hologram - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 05 October 2015)

quote: Who told you to die? Keep fighting!
author: Commissar Otto Xavier

quote: Heroes of Armageddon! You have withstood the evil savagery of the Orks, and they have nothing left for you to fear. So raise high the black banners of vengeance - now is our time.
author: Commissar Sebastian Yarrick

quote: This planet is a hellhole, but it’ll be an Imperial hellhole when we’re through with it.
author: Zhaebin, Lieutenant, Vostroyan Firstborn
bookSource: FFG Teaser for "Jungles of Nectavus", supplement for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest (last accessed 3 March 2016)

quote: We draw the line here! Sergeants, pass the word out, we give no ground, we stand and we die in the name of the Emperor!
author: Zoutah, Commissar, Catachan 'Wild Cats'
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Chosen Ground - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 7 October 2015)

quote: Competence on the battlefield is a myth. The side which screws up next to last wins, it's as simple as that.
author: Lord General Zyvan
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) – Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. Ten, pg. 611

quote: Infantry win firefights. Tanks win battles. Artillery win wars.
author: Old saying amongst Imperial Guard artillery officers

quote: Incoming fire has the right of way.
author: Old artilleryman's maxim

quote:
The Emperor points, and we obey,
Through the warp and far away.
author: From a warriors' song of the Imperial Guard
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 4, pg. 86

quote: Hurry up and wait.
author: Guardsman's traditional summation of the process of deployment

quote:
Whatever happens, we have got
The Emperor’s blessing. They have not.
author: From The Guardsman's Duty, a popular ballad

quote:
When in deadly danger,
When beset by doubt,
Run in little circles,
Wave your arms and shout.
author: Parody of the Litany of Command, popular among Commissar Cadets

quote: Things can always get worse.
author: Valhallan proverb

quote: It's never too late to panic.
author: Popular Valhallan folk saying

quote: Any Cadian who can't field-strip his own lasgun by age ten was born on the wrong planet.
author: Anonymous

quote: Please try to run. It would save me lots of problems.
author: Unknown Commissar
bookSource: 13th Legion (Novel) - The Last Chancers (Omnibus), ch. Six, pg. 179

quote: Glory for the first man to die, charge!
author: Unknown Commissar

quote: Stop bleeding and fight back!
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: CAPTURING it was easy. HOLDING it will be hard.
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: Those are Eldar? I thought they'd be taller.
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: Tanks! Where are the bloody tanks?!
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: Concentrate all fire on that big bruiser!
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: For every one of us who falls, ten more will take his place!
author: Unknown Guardsman

quote: Nah, soon as you're old enough you're sent to join the regiment. Colonel Stagler don't approve of educated men, says it was educated men that got Krieg bombed to shit in the first place. The colonel says that all a man needs to do is fight and die. That's the Krieg way.
author: Unknown Guardsman
bookSource: Warriors of Ultramar (Novel) - Ultramarines: The Omnibus, ch. 6, pg. 358

quote: When the people forget their duty they are no longer human and become something less than beasts. They have no place in the bosom of humanity nor in the heart of the Emperor. Let them die and be forgotten.
author: Prime Edicts of the Holy Synod of the Adeptus Ministorum

quote: Imperial citizens who undertake the arduous seven year 'Pilgrimage of Macharius' must obtain the Solar Medal before they set forth. The medal can only be purchased at the Offices of the Pilgrimorium on the shrine world of Macharia, and entitles the pilgrim to seek passage on any craft traveling along the prescribed pilgrimage routes.
author: Excerpt from The Road of Salvation: A Guide to Following in the Steps of the Prophets and Saints of the Imperium
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex), inside back cover

quote: The Heretic and Blasphemer can offer no excuse for their crimes. Those who are pardoned merely live to further shroud Humanity from the Light of the Emperor with the Darkness of their souls.
author: from the Sermons of Cardinal Beneficta
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 24

quote: The glory we gain blinds us first with its lustre.
author: Caddaway, Redemptionist theologian
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus) Editorial note after ch. 10, pg. 624

quote: On the Day of Affirmation it is the custom to light a candle, small and sweetly scented, and while it burns to silently think on those days so long ago. For a few minutes every year the whole universe of mankind falls silent and bends its mind to one purpose - billions of billions of souls drawn together in memory of the Great Confessor.
author: Dolan Chirosius

quote: I tread the path of Righteousness. Though it be paved with broken glass, I will walk it barefoot; though it cross rivers of fire, I will pass over them; though it wanders wide, the light of the Emperor guides my step.
author: Dolan Chirosius
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 44

quote: It is the story of a man who did insane things because he put in practice what many Saints have preached.
author: Dolan Chirosius
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 9

quote: Men united in the purpose of the Emperor are blessed in his sight, and shall live forever in his memory.
author: Ecclesiarch Deacis IX

quote: The words of the faithful are the mountains. But the deeds of the faithful are the world.
author: Ecclesiarch Deacis IX

quote: No army is big enough to conquer the galaxy. But faith alone can overturn the universe.
author: Ecclesiarch Deacis IX

quote: One man can start a landslide with the casting of a single pebble.
author: Ecclesiarch Deacis IX
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 12

quote: Taking the long view is all well and prudent, but take care that you don’t become so preoccupied with it that you miss what’s right under your nose.
author: Saint Emelia
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 13, pg. 215

quote: The path to duty is often a stony one, made smoother by thought for others.
author: Saint Emelia
bookSource: Duty Calls (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Defender of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. Twenty-Four, pg. 462

quote: Never forget you are the walls of steel and iron, between Mankind and a thousand horrors too unspeakable to name. You are the walls of Hell.
author: Preacher Eran Gudi
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 55

quote: Prayer may cleanse the soul, but pain cleanses the body. Both are necessary for the survival of humanity.
author: Confessor Ganinimus
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 55

quote: I long for death, not because I seek peace, but because I seek the war eternal.
author: Cardinal Armandus Helfire

quote: The Daemonic leads to two crimes. You turn away from the path of righteousness. And you abandon the Emperor as the object of your devotion. For the first, death is merely a just retribution. The second is a heresy so terrible that no punishment can be sufficient. Yet the search for an appropriate penalty continues, and it shall be found.
author: Ecclesiarch Issus XLVII
bookSource: Realm of Chaos: Slaves to Darkness, pg. 260 reprinted in Codex: Daemonhunters (3rd Edition), pg. 19

quote: Death in service to the Emperor is its own reward. Life in failure to Him is its own condemnation.
author: Uriah Jacobus

quote: The Emperor of Mankind is the Light and the Way, and all his actions are for the benefit of mankind, which is his people. The Emperor is God and God is the Emperor, so it is taught in the Lectio Divinitatus, and above all things, the Emperor will protect...
author: Euphrati Keeler, Remembrancer
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part Two, ch. Six, pg. 330

quote: A Heretic may see the truth and seek redemption. He may be forgiven his past and will be absolved in death. A Traitor can never be forgiven. A Traitor will never find peace in this world or the next. There is nothing as wretched or as hated in all the world as a Traitor.
author: Cardinal Khrysdam

quote: A swarm of mechanised locusts sweeping over the land, stripping it bare of resources, bringing death and destruction to anything that stands in its path. Emperor preserve us against the predations of these so-called Orkish Cults of Speed.
author: Cardinal Nomura
bookSource: Fantasy Flight Games teaser of the "Deadly Salvage" - War Pack for the Conquest Card Game (last accessed 7 July 2015)

quote: When it was over, when the blood had dried and the fires had died down, then we found we were the same as we had always been - small and terrified human beings, with only the light of the Emperor to see by in this dark galaxy of sin.
author: Saint Praxides of Ophelia VII

quote: There are no miracles. There are only men.
author: Saint Sabbat
bookSource: The Sabbat Worlds Crusade (Background Book), pg. 9 Honour Guard (Novel), Ch. 17

quote: Betwixt the wash of the river and the waft of the wind, let my sins be transfigured to virtues.
author: Saint Sabbat

quote: If the road is easy, the destination is worthless.
author: Saint Sabbat

quote: Let the sky welcome you, for therein dwells the Emperor and his saints.
author: Saint Sabbat

quote: Though my tears be as many as the spots of rain falling in the Hagian woods, one for every fallen soul loyal to the Throne, there would not be enough.
author: Saint Sabbat

quote: As I have been called to the holy work, so I will call others to me.
author: Saint Sabbat

quote: A single man with faith can triumph over a legion of the faithless. Untold billions of the faithful can never be opposed.
author: Sebastian Thor
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 11

quote: The Emperor is our Father and our Guardian, but we must also guard the Emperor.
author: Sebastian Thor
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 15

quote: I will steal from the plate of decadence to feed the mouths of the powerless.
author: Sebastian Thor
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 16

quote: A war waged by committee is a war already lost.
author: Sebastian Thor
bookSource: Necropolis (Novel) by Dan Abnett, ch. 6, pg. 83

quote: The strength of the Emperor is Humanity, and the strength of Humanity is the Emperor. If one turns from the other we shall all become the Lost and the Damned.
author: Sebastian Thor
bookSource: Codex: Sisters of Battle (2nd Edition), pg. 54

quote: Give me a gun that never fires! Give me sword that is ever blunt! Give me a weapon that deals no wound as long as it always strikes awe!
author: Sebastian Thor

quote: You are the dark heart of man, Leto. You are the evil that can lurk in any of us, the potential to commit the most heinous acts and do it with a smile on our faces. There is a wall of conscience between acts of good and evil inside most of us, but that's missing in you. I don't know why, but for you there is no concept of evil, just results.
author: Cardinal Shavo Togandis
bookSource: The Killing Ground (Novel) ch. Nineteen, pg. 284

quote: Though the darkness will be rent by noise and flame. Let not men's souls be broken in the crucible of war.
author: Preacher Veltros Theodorus before the third assault on Tarrisus Ridge
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 9

quote: Fortune deliver you by the nine holy wounds!
author: Ayatani blessing

quote: From this high rock, from this peak, let the light of worship shine so that the Emperor himself might see it from his Golden Throne.
author: Dedication on the high altar of the Tempelum Infarfarid Sabbat

quote: The weak will always be led by the strong. Where the strong see purpose and act, the weak follow; where the strong cry out against fate, the weak bow their heads and succumb. There are many who are weak; and many are their temptations. Despise the weak for they shall flock to the call of the Daemon and the Renegade. Pity them not and scorn their cries of innocence - it is better that one hundred innocently fall before the wrath of the Emperor than one kneels before the Daemon.
author: The First Book of Indoctrinations
bookSource: Realm of Chaos: Slaves to Darkness, pg. 230

quote: Know this adept, for your journey has been long and you are to be trusted as few will ever be. Psykers represent Humanity's future, the ideal creature into which mankind will evolve; a more powerful, more intelligent and more capable life form. As yet this race is weak, its members lacking the mental strength needed to face the dangers of the psychic universe. Were the new race of psykers permitted to develop free and unprotected, the whole of Humanity would soon be destroyed. We few who are privy to this truth have guarded it selflessly for nigh on four millennia, since the end of the great schism from which our order was born. It is our sole concern, for the very future of our race depends upon us, and us alone.
author: Transcription of suppressed texts, from the archives of the Gethsemene Reclusium

quote: So great has been the calamitousness of these times, and such the inveterate malice of the heretics, that there has been nothing ever so clear in our statement of faith, nothing so surely settled, which they, at the instigation of the enemy of the human race, have not defiled by some sort of error. For which cause the holy Inquisition hath made it Its especial care to condemn and anathematise the principal errors of the heretics of our time, and to deliver and teach the true and Imperial doctrine; even as It has condemned, anathematised, and decreed.
author: Declaration of Inquisitorial mandate, Inquisitorial representative, Senate Imperialis

quote: His loyalty couldn't be bought at any price; but it could be rented remarkably cheaply.
author: Inquisitor Allendyne
bookSource: The Traitor's Hand (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 9, pg. 601

quote: He who allows the alien to live shares in the crime of its existence.
author: Inquisitor Apollyon, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: Warrior Coven (Novel) - Kill Squad: A Deathwatch Omnibus, ch. 2, pg. 202

quote: Inquisitors? They’re sneaky bastards. Useful, yes, even necessary, but I wouldn’t buy a used aircar from any of them.
author: Arbitrator General Bex van Sturm
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 8, pg. 133

quote: Of creations most foul I beheld the Lord of All and knew that I was dead.
author: Inquisitor Brand
bookSource: Codex: Daemonhunters (3rd Edition), pg. 18; Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus

quote: Turning the weapons of the enemy against him is, of course, of grave danger to one’s soul. It is nonetheless a satisfying thing to see.
author: Inquisitor Havelock Brundsted

quote: I'm sure most of the men in the galaxy are familiar with the sinking feeling that accompanies the words "Do you think you could do me a little favour, darling?", but when the woman asking the question is an inquisitor it's even less wise than usual to say "No".
author: Commissar Ciaphas Cain
bookSource: Duty Calls (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Defender of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 6, pg. 303

quote: This is the Emperor’s planet, the Emperor’s Throne damn you. You want it, you traitor pigs? Come take it from us!
author: Caspiel Rex, Inquisitor
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Hold At All Costs - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: There are those amongst our Ordo who say that I seek advancement for my own purposes, and they are correct. My purpose is to destroy the daemonic and if I must rise to command an entire sector to do so, then so be it. I am a servant of the Emperor and only those who consort with Warp-spawn need fear my ambition.
author: Inquisitor Lord Torquemada Coteaz

quote: Things are very seldom what they seem. In my experience, they’re usually a damn sight worse.
author: Inquisitor Titus Drake
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 9, pg. 155

quote: I am forty-two standard years old, in my prime by Imperial standards, young by those of the Inquisition. All my life, I have had a reputation for being cold, unfeeling. Some have called me heartless, ruthless, even cruel. I am not. I am not beyond emotional response or compassion. But I possess - and my masters count this as perhaps my paramount virtue - a singular force of will. Throughout my career it has served me well to draw on this facility and steel myself, unflinching, at all that this wretched galaxy can throw at me. To feel pain or fear or grief is to allow myself a luxury I cannot afford.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: I'm excusing a lot because I recognize the trauma and the loss you have suffered. But my patience isn't limitless... unlike my authority.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: I'm an inquisitor. I do not get angry.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: My lord, what foetid corner of the Imperium breeds these fawning idiots? Now you really owe me.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: The guilty and the polluted fight. They deny. They struggle. In my lifetime, I have brought down nine marked Diabolus. None went quietly.
author: Inquisitor Gregor Eisenhorn

quote: We are at War with forces too terrible to comprehend. We cannot afford mercy for any of its victims too weak to take the correct course. Mercy destroys us; it weakens us and saps our resolve. Put aside all such thoughts. They are not worthy of Inquisitors in the service of Our Emperor. Praise His name for in our resolve we only reflect his purpose of will.
author: The Book of Exorcisms, the Verses of Inquisitor Enoch
bookSource: Realm of Chaos: Slaves to Darkness, pg. 220

quote: Your daily work brings you closer and closer to the warp, increases your understanding of orderless powers. Gradually, without noticing it, even the most puritanical and rod-stiff inquisitor becomes seduced... The first step is the knowledge. An inquisitor must understand the basic traits of Chaos in order to fight it. In a few years, he knows more about the warp than most untutored cultists. Then the second step: the moment he breaks the rules and allows some aspect of Chaos to survive or remain so that he can study it and learn from it... The third stepg... the third step is the line itself. When the inquisitor becomes a radical. When he chooses to use Chaos against Chaos. When he employs the agencies of the warpg. When he asks the heretical for helpg... So... are you going to ask me to help you?
author: Pontius Glaw

quote: The daemonic are without number, and their legions span the galaxy. But faith does not tire. Should it take us an eternity, the Ordo Malleus will find and exterminate them all.
author: Lord Hephaestos Grudd

quote: Look upon this hammer I hold before me, for it is far more than a weapon. It is a symbol of the Imperial justice that smites the diabolic enemies of the Imperium wherever they are found, just as I. Though it has banished even a mighty Greater Daemon to the hell from which it was spawned, it remains true and pure, just as I. Furthermore, it is a symbol of my order and my office, of the authority granted to me by the divine will of the Emperor. By that authority, I am commanding you and your entire regiment to obey me without question or hesitation. Advance, or it will not be daemonic blood that stains my hammer this day.
author: Lord Hephaestos Grudd

quote: You must face the truth squarely and without flinching from duty. Our Enemies are mortal no longer. Mercy for such as they is a chimera, self-deception is its only ally. Dedicate this weapon, given unto your hand at the behest of the Emperor, to their destruction. Regard its function as your only duty: you live only to bring cleansing fire. Take up your rod and staff, your armour and psycannon, and go forth.
author: Inquisitor Historical Galbus Heer
bookSource: Realm of Chaos: Slaves to Darkness, pg. 253

quote: There is no such thing as a plea of innocence in my court. A plea of innocence is guilty of wasting my time. Guilty.
author: Inquisitor Lord Fyodor Karamazov

quote: There is no end to the abomination of the alien. Do not allow any guise of sentience to stay your hand – there can be no hesitation when the survival of humanity as a species is at stake.
author: Inquisitor Kartize, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: Fantasy Flight Games - Teaser to "Enemies Without", Supplement to Dark Heresy Second Edition, (last accessed 9 August 2015)

quote: One cannot consider the fate of a single man, nor ten, nor a hundred, nor a thousand. Billions will live or die by our actions here, and we have not the luxury to count the cost.
author: Inquisitor Kryptmann (presumably Kryptman)

quote: They are beyond comprehension, beyond mortal flesh, beyond even time and mortality. They are beyond many things, but never my hate!
author: Inquisitor Lias du Ortise, Ordo Malleus
bookSource: FFG Site Teaser for Enemy Beyond Supplement for Dark Heresy Second Edition - (last accessed 16 October 2015)

quote: Do not presume to judge me or the methods I choose to employ, petty-minded fool. You cannot comprehend the magnitude of the task I have undertaken nor the consequences of my failure.
author: Inquisitor Lichtenstein, declared Excommunicate Traitoris 998.M41

quote: If you can confront the xenos, look upon the xenos, even think upon the xenos, without revulsion, then you are as damned as they.
author: Inquisitor Loffengar, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: FFG Site Teaser for Enemy Without Supplement for Dark Heresy Second Edition (last accessed 11 October 2015)

quote: You are Astartes indeed, and that will never alter. But you are a Death Guard no longer. You are a ghost, a figure that stands between light and dark, trapped amid the grey. And I have need of such a man.
author: Malcador the Sigillite
bookSource: Garro: Oath of Moment (Audio Book), Track 5: Flashback

quote: You get more with a kind word and an Excruciator than with just a kind word.
author: Inquisitor Malden
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 2, pg. 47

quote: Though Mankind is at the brink of this great apotheosis, you must be ever vigilant for the stillborn harbingers of this change. Where you seek the pure and strong, there too will you find the impure and weak. Where you find but one worthy of life, you will also find a million twisted, deformed monstrosities for whom death by your hand is a mercy. Therefore, look first for the mutant, for he may never hide his sin from you, and in his midst there will be revealed to you that which you seek. But be ever vigilant, for even should you find one with the gift, only one in a thousand psykers will be strong enough to resist the perils of the Empyrean and be allowed to live.
author: Inquisitor Malich

quote: Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of the daemon, I shall fear nothing. For I am what the daemon fears.
author: Grand Master Mandulis of the Grey Knights

quote: The place breeds recidivists like a pond breeds scum.
author: Inquisitor-General Neve

quote: Now the past must unveil one of its darkest secrets, the story of the Plague of Unbelief and its most heinous vector Bucharis the Apostate Cardinal of Gathalamor. Never has the Imperium endured such a crisis of faith, not since the dark days of the Horus Heresy itself.
author: Galan Noirgrim, Master of the Ordo Malleus

quote: Gregor Eisenhorn, in fealty to the God-Emperor, our undying lord, and by the grace of the Golden Throne, in the name of the Ordo Malleus and the Inquisition, I call thee diabolis, and in the testimony of thy crimes, I submit this carta. May imperial justice account in all balance. The Emperor protects.
author: Grand Master Osma of the Ordos Helican

quote: My enemy’s enemy is a problem for later: In the meantime, they might be useful.
author: Inquisitor Quixos
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 12, pg. 201

quote: Chaos claims the unwary or the incomplete. A true man may flinch away its embrace, if he is stalwart, and he girds his soul with the armour of contempt.
author: Inquisitor Gideon Ravenor

quote: The creatures of the Warp have but one trait with which you need concern yourself - their undying contempt for the Emperor. It is your task to quell the rebellion they preach, and the only sure way is to destroy them utterly.
author: Qualtak Shoran, Inquisitor
bookSource: White Dwarf 114 (UK), pg. 11; Warhammer 40,000 Compendium, pg.5

quote: Trust in the God-Emperor. But trust your blade, too.
author: Inquisitor Atellus Thrax

quote: Even if you could take us both, and I sincerely doubt that, I've lost count of the number of people I've met who thought they could outrun the Inquisition. But you might as well give it a try if you really want to. After all, there's a first time for everything.
author: Inquisitor Amberley Vail, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: For the Emperor (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Hero of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 10, pg. 172

quote: So there it is: unimaginably ancient Xenos artefact somewhere on the planet in the hands of a renegade, the hive fleet poised above our heads ready to rip this world apart, hidden 'stealer broods everywhere making an early start on their behalf, and now a bloody Chaos cult crawling out of the woodwork just in case we were getting bored. Welcome to my world, Ciaphas.
author: Inquisitor Amberley Vail, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: Duty Calls (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Defender of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 11, pg. 345

quote: Some Inquisitors believe the Emperor’s work is best done by charging around the place like a grox in a ceramic emporium, leaving a trail of carnage and destruction in their wake, while others prefer not to let the enemies of all that’s good and holy get clean away by making it blindingly obvious they’re coming for them.
author: Inquisitor Amberley Vail, Ordo Xenos
bookSource: Duty Calls (Novel) - Ciaphas Cain: Defender of the Imperium (Omnibus), ch. 12, pg. 349, fn. 1

quote: Curses! Just when you've finally managed to bring the whole world under your evil influence some pathetic little Inquisitor goes whining off to the Adeptus Terra about rogue psykers and daemonic possession. I mean, do I look possessed? Well, do I? DO I???
author: Lord Varlak

quote: Seek not the words of the xenos, lest they infect us with blasphemy.
author: Admonitions Mechanae 3:16

quote: Without a Standard Model, there is naught but madness and Chaos among the stars.
author: Aetheric Manuscripts Appendix 71

quote: Thus does the Enemy seek to crush our spirit, for our souls are our most potent weapon.
author: Amalanthians 9.41

quote: If it resembles a heretic, if it speaks like a heretic, and if it be redolent to the nose, as if like a heretic, then a heretic it will be!
author: Amarinthine Admonitions

quote: We fight the foe’s battle for him, when we take his words into our hearts.
author: Amalathian Commentaries Chapter 94

quote: No task that is easy is ever worthwhile.
author: Amaranthine Verses 78.12

quote: Failure is unique among sin, in that we can turn it into a virtue when it drives us to succeed.
author: Antonine Musings 901.45

quote: There are horrors in this galaxy that only faith and steel can overcome, and that we should be grateful we shall never fully understand.
author: Aphorisms 7.1

quote: Grant a coward the excuse to retreat from the battlefield and he will never fight again.
author: Aphorisms 7.31

quote: Look not upon the alien, for the alien looks back.
author: Aphorisms 56

quote: The Enemy rushes to action, when our ministrations cause him fear
author: Aphorisms 94.13

quote: If it is worth doing, it is worth doing to completion.
author: Aphorisms 97

quote: In the presence of the xenos lies the invisible miasma of corruption.
author: Aphorisms of the Logic-Saints 7.91

quote: And we shall cast them down, that corrupt by their presence; We shall break the teeth of the xenos that would swallow us whole.
author: Appendix Heuristica 73.90

quote: They need not rend us with their blades. They have but to make us witness them, and thereby can we fall.
author: Armageddon Verses 13.90

quote: Fragile indeed are the tools of the righteous.
author: Avelornians 5.91

quote: The only will of the Machine Spirit is that of the Omnissian technologies, for the Xenos will deceive you and tempt you, but you will not falter, for you are a Priest.
author: Cannot unless you Canticle v.34

quote: Inefficiency is a slope whereupon one slides ever downwards, by degrees, until one reaches the nadir unknowing.
author: Canticles Borealis 6.15

quote: When we muse on the works of the enemy, we invite him into our minds.
author: Canticles Flamminia 713

quote: Where corruption remains, men will fall.
author: Canticles Logica 6.41

quote: Let the weaker in mind follow the words of the strong!
author: Canticles of Gethsemenoth Line 87

quote: Rejoice. Give thanks. For we are but one step now from triumph.
author: Canticles of Mars 79.12

quote: Thus are the wages of those who delve too deep.
author: Castigations 17.4

quote: Show caution and scorn in all things.
author: Codex Fulminatus 83.12

quote: A Tech-Priest eschews the illogicality of fear, the unbalanced equation of doubt, the broken circuit of failure.
author: Cognis Amalathian 5.89

quote: And lo, shall Your holy steel be as armour around our souls, and shall Your wisdom guide our hands. No spear nor barb of the enemy shall trouble our flesh of iron. Let the will of Mars be done!
author: Collected Logic-Psalms 31.3

quote: It’s not work if you enjoy it.
author: Colloquialisms Minor Chapter 51

quote: Enough fire in the right place can solve any problem.
author: Colloquialisms of Metalica Chapter 52

quote: Blessed is he who, in death, does his duty.
author: Conceptua Comprehensis Verse 329

quote: There can be no forgiveness now. No penitence that will satisfy my sin.
author: Confessions of Logic-Saint Levistian

quote: Death itself is scarcely an excuse for the sin of duty undone.
author: Contemplations Hagiographica

quote: Protect the shield of the mind, and the body will be shielded thereby.
author: Epigrams of Saint Eukelsis 3.89

quote: Wheresoever the blasphemer writes, obliterate.
author: Epigraphs Macrologica Psalm 105

quote: Men fuelled by the righteousness of their purpose can achieve what armies cannot.
author: Eukelkisians 60.24

quote: The Lord of Mars is with us in the dark, even if thou knowest it not.
author: Exaltations 49

quote: We are all but a weapon in the right hand of the Emperor.
author: Exhortationes Principiis Titannorum, Divisio Militaris

quote: Not all data should be acquired.
author: Formulae Technologia Verses 4-27

quote: And endeavour is its own reward.
author: Gathalamorians 6.13

quote: When the final analysis is fully calculated, all equations balance against righteous annihilation.
author: Gathalamorians 9.41

quote: Above bullets, above blades, care for your soul above all.
author: Gathalamorians 45.7

quote: He who prosecutes the alien with zeal, is the ally of Mankind.
author: Gathalamorians 60.41

quote: By Flame Shall The Unclean Be Made Clean, By Fire Shall The Unholy Be Made Holy.
author: Gathalamorians 71.6

quote: Even in the deepest darkness, give devotion to the Omnissiah, for there He is needed the most.
author: Gathalamorians 71.30

quote: Be thou wary of the works of the alien, for their presence is poison and their every word deceit.
author: Gathalamorians 94.3

quote: He who aids the blasphemer, even through ignorance, has the blood of the faithful upon his hands!
author: Gathalamorians 97.14

quote: Obliterate his words, cut out his tongue, put to fire all wrought by his hand, and the heretic shall cease to exist.
author: Gathalamorians 714.5

quote: Purification is the prelude to annihilation.
author: Hagiographies of Saint Regulavis 91.12

quote: He who sows doubt is as blameful as he who sheds blood.
author: Hagiography of Thor 14.91

quote: When the enemy begs for destruction, do not let him go hungry.
author: Helfirian Recollections Chapter 571

quote: The tree of heresy persists were its roots be not torn up.
author: Jovian Commentaries Chapter 59
