quote: When the heretic is silenced, it is as if his weapons and tools are stripped from him, he is left impotent and weak.
author: Jovian Ministrations 61.90

quote: It is a rare man whose faith survives the failings of his superiors.
author: Jovian Tutelage 56.41

quote: The sweet incense of faith conquers the toxic stench of corruption.
author: Kalemnan Orations 5.25

quote: Wheresoever the sacred man tread, led it be made pure, or say he is not sacred.
author: Keraptic Inscriptions Chapter 15

quote: Ware the script of the enemy! For writ into its lies are the seeds of corruption.
author: Kryptmann Verses 11-13

quote: Bleak be the prospects, when the black wind of heresy blows.
author: Levistians 7.14

quote: Knowledge will ever be a blessing and a curse.
author: Levistians 9.22

quote: Our only objective should be death to the alien and all his works. All else is deviance from the Omnissiah Creed.
author: Life of Archmagos Borasis Appendix 9

quote: Annihilation. Not exile, submission or subjugation. For the xenos, only annihilation.
author: Life of Fabricator General Kane 56.90

quote: Then into the teeth of the enemy we shall stride.
author: Life of Macharius 23.19

quote: Faith is light, and where it burns, there is no night.
author: Life of Saint Hermeticus 5.23

quote: Improvisation is rarely to be welcomed, and then only when the Omnissiah’s will demands it.
author: Linguis Fulminatus Chapter 7

quote: If it has not a head to sever, cut out the heart.
author: Lives of Gyarados 73.60

quote: The circuits are complete. The engine of fate is primed. One turn of the cog remains, and the grand machine shall fulfil its purpose.
author: Logistae Septimus 21.4

quote: And when at last he came upon the vehicle, he perceived the distress of the engine therein and forthwith struck the rune and it was good. Thereupon the engine ignited and was filled with strength...
author: Lord of the Engines, 16th Tome, Verse 2001

quote: Watch your brother, for his sin of heresy is thy sin of tolerance.
author: Macharians 16.4

quote: The wilful child is as the maddened steed: when it is let off its leash, it is lost.
author: Macharian Axioms Line 918

quote: As we purify the ground beneath their feet, they shall find no shelter!
author: Macharian Commentaries Chapter 71

quote: Seek profane knowledge, and find profane fates.
author: Macharian Commentaries 73.5

quote: Let the foe blunt their blades against our resolve. They will be ash and memories soon enough.
author: Macharian Duologues Chapter 61

quote: Better safe and ignorant, than rueing the means of our downfall.
author: Macharian Notions Chapter 4113

quote: First comes knowledge of destruction, then its execution.
author: Malchadorian Insights 17.4

quote: From such small heresies are great apostasies made.
author: Maxims Metalica 76.12

quote: Beware the deviance of thine own tools, for the Enemy finds his entrance thereby.
author: Maxims of Amalanth 5.12

quote: How dim the sacred light burns when the unholy darkness loometh all about.
author: Meditations Logicae Verse 619

quote: When the corruption of the unholy becomes manifest to our senses, a far greater corruption lies unseen.
author: Meditations on the Superlogicae Verse 971

quote: Blessed is that life that, in its ending, forgives a lifetime of sin.
author: Memoirs of Saint Hestios 5.25

quote: Thus does Mankind fail. Not in knowing betrayal, but in the silent sin of duty neglected.
author: Mensis Hagiographica Appendix 91

quote: If His Will be done, let it be done quickly.
author: Neodogmatics 71.90

quote: We are derelict in our duty whenever we allow corruption to plague the minds of good men.
author: Observations on the Tech-Cosmos Verse 68

quote: The Omnissiah demands the stain of the xenos be deleted. Where it remains, the Omnissiah rages.
author: Opus Fulminata

quote: Let His word be exalted to the eleventh degree.
author: Principae Logica 22.4

quote: The xenos must be purged, for the stars are humanity’s birthright.
author: Psalms Hermeticus 46

quote: From the mouths of heretics emit naught but foul vapours. Cut out the tongue and be clean.
author: Quaestos Mechanicor 5.21

quote: Of all creations most foul I beheld the Lord of All and knew that I was dead.
author: Recollections of Inquisitor Brand Chapter 87

quote: I beheld the babel of the enemy’s tongues, and I was overwhelmed by a wall of heresy.
author: Recollections of Saint Hesperis Volume 17

quote: The enemy shall take what we give him, and reap a harvest behind our backs besides, until whole worlds are lost to our sight.
author: Revelations of Titan 18.12

quote: The beast of metal endures longer than the flesh of men. Those that tend the beasts of metal must labour long to learn its ways, for a single beast must suffer the mastership of many men until ready to shed its vorpal coils. Those that seek apprenticeship must attended closely to the runes of mobilisation, the rites of maintenance, and the words-of-power that describe the parts of a beast. Nor must they neglect the tutelage of the Adeptus Prefects, nor the casting of the proper roboscopes.
author: Runic Mechanics - An Introduction

quote: Strike the first rune upon the engine's casing employing the chosen wrench. Its tip should be anointed with the oil of engineering using the proper incantation when the auspices are correct. Strike the second rune upon the engine's casing employing the arc-tip of the power-driver. If the second rune is not good, a third rune may be struck in like manner to the first. This is done according to the true ritual laid down by Scotti the Enginseer. A libation should be offered. If this sequence is properly observed the engines may be brought to full activation by depressing the large panel marked "ON".
author: Runic Spaceflight - An Introduction; Naval Flight Manual W110E

quote: The loose tongues of our soldiers are as guns in the hands of our enemies.
author: Saturnine Verses 81.4

quote: Prayer has power, but I cannot deny fire does, too.
author: Sayings of Archmagos Cortiko Verse 58

quote: Such sweet music is the chatter of binary, that has no tongue to lie.
author: Sayings of the Archmagi Appendix 4

quote: When thou desirest to discourse purely, use binary.
author: Sayings of the Princeps 65.4

quote: Wary of those that wonder.
author: Scripture of the Taloned Cog v.09 p.3

quote: Sometimes the weak limb must be amputated before the whole body withers.
author: Selucian Aphorisms Verse 539

quote: One can verge from the standard form, but one must always retain their humanity, or be lost to the Men of Iron and their ways.
author: Text of the Oiled Cog v.12

quote: When uttering the incantation, mark well that the rod is upon and not within the intake. The second incantation should not be uttered until all the fumes have come forth, then the way shall be clear for the sacred words to penetrate unto the heart of the engine. If the mounting be hot say the third rune, if it be cold the fourth rune is more appropriate. For then the wrath of the engine will be aroused...
author: The Book of Five Runes

quote: An opportunity wasted is a sin preserved.
author: The Life of Fabricator General Heuristicus VII

quote: When the enemy offers open battle, take it, and make it his final mistake.
author: The Life of Uriah Jacobus 8.31

quote:
The soul of the Machine God surrounds thee.
The power of the Machine God invests thee.
The hate of the Machine God drives thee.
The Machine God endows thee with life.
Live!
author: The Litany of Ignition

quote: Even In Death, Our Duty Is Not Complete.
author: The Lives of the Logic-Saints Psalm 61

quote: What the enemy built, let it be made asunder, for to us it will be as a house of sand and knives.
author: Themiscyran Manuscripts Verse 619

quote: The broken in body can blame the bullet or the sword, but the broken in mind have all creation to curse.
author: Verses Fulminatus 59.31

quote: The only logical response to the presence of the xenos, is hatred.
author: Verses Macrologica 17.4

quote: To every problem, a solution lies in the application of tech-lore.
author: Ferrarch Asklepian

quote: By acuteness of mind shall we find victory.
author: Fabricator-General Explicatus

quote: The universe is not like a puzzle-box that you can take apart and put back together again and so solve its secrets. It is a shifting uncertain thing which changes as you consider it, which is changed by the very act of observation. A powerful man is not a man who dissects the universe like a puzzle-box, examining it piece by piece and measuring each piece with scientific precision. A powerful man has only to look upon the universe to change it.
author: Technomagos Gaelos

quote: The weak in mind will seek to understand the xenos. The strong in mind will destroy them, and bless their ignorance.
author: Binary Hierarch Gethsemorr

quote: Hark not the alien's words, lest ye unknowingly repeat them.
author: Archmagos Veneratus Haelon

quote: Let the stench of corruption be swept aside by the sweet winds of faith.
author: Archmagos Veneratus Hieraticus

quote: The best way of improving a gun is to improve its ammunition.
author: Hieronymus, High Magos and Arch-heretic of Artemia Majoris (was terminated on request of Fabricator-General)
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume One - Imperial Guard and Imperial Navy, pg. 204

quote: Through the application of knowledge can great destruction arise…
author: Fabricator-General Isotor

quote: All shall be darkness, all shall be madness, for everything will be known and nothing forbidden.
author: Fabricator-General Jaegaron

quote: Our enemies may rest but rust never sleeps.
author: Tech-Priest Jung, Forge World Gehenna
bookSource: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000, pg. 59

quote: You may say, it is impossible for a man to become like the Machine. And I would reply, that only the smallest mind strives to comprehend its limits.
author: Fabricator General Kane

quote: There's no turning back... Triumph or oblivion.
author: The spirit of Ramus Macabee speaking to Ervin Hekate

quote: The foe of reason builds monuments to his madness, and reveals himself thereby.
author: Malcador

quote: A man may die yet still endure if his work enters the greater work. Time is carried upon a current incepted by forgotten deeds. Events of great moment are but the culmination of a single carefully placed thought. As all men must thank progenitors obscured by the past so we must endure the present that those who come after may continue the greater work.
author: Garba Mojaro, Prefectus of Adeptus Mechanicus

quote: Take care with that! We have not fully ascertained its function, and the ticking is accelerating.
author: Technographer Adar Millez
bookSource: Dark Heresy: The Lathe Worlds, pg. 69

quote: Less exalted minds might waver to learn the secrets of the xenos. But we are stronger. We are better.
author: Archmagos Nerovian

quote: The eyes of the Omnissiah are ever upon us.
author: Fabricator-General Plutonis

quote: The supporting fire of one's brethren is always a comfort. Provided it doesn't hit oneself.
author: Grand Master Thordun Ranxey, Death Bolts

quote: To perceive the grander picture, to strive to acquire and understand for the benefit of all mankind.
author: Tech-Acquisitor Scaevola, Statement of Purpose

quote: Obey the Standard Model, or obey the laws of death.
author: Fabricator-General Sin-Cosinius

quote: For the alien, nothing.
author: Legio Victorum Motto
bookSource: Third War For Armageddon - Imperial Forces: The Legio Victorum (archived page, last accessed via Wayback Machine 13 December 2022)

quote: The Omnissiah directs our footsteps along the path of knowledge.
author: Techpriest Yaffel

quote: It is my great regret that we live in an age that is proud of machines that think and suspicious of people who try to.
author: Adept Koriel Zeth, Forge Mistress

quote: Know thy Enemy, to Know Thyself: In each society there is a classification that is mirrored in another society…
author: Magos Tech-Auxilium Prime

quote: Blessed is the mind too small for doubt.
Look not upon the alien, for the alien looks back.
Blessed is the ignorance that wise men choose for themselves.
Deny the enemy his works and means, then deny to him his life.
Fury has its uses.
Let knowledge serve only man, and let that which does not remain in darkness.
Behold thou corruption, and unthinking, end it.
Blessed be the coruscating plasma of the engine room, Spiritus Machina protect us from thy burning doom. Harness unto our will the power of light, Let conduit and coil work alright.
author: Catechism of the Engin-near

quote: There is nothing better that a man can do than lay down his life in the service of the Emperor.
author: Inscription at the top of the Gothic Monolith in the Chamber of Heroes

quote: You are expected at all times and in all situations to conduct yourself in a manner appropriate to, and mindful of, the great duties and traditions of the Emperor's Most Glorious and Honourable Navy.
author: Opening line of the Imperial Navy Articles of War

quote: His great art was to be in the right place at the right time - others were not so cunning.
author: Compel Bast, Captain

quote: This is Fury Squadron commencing fly-over, don’t worry Colonel, we’ve got you covered
author: Bayde, Lieutenant of the 104th 'Fury' Thunderbolt Squadron
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Interdicition - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: The whole principle of naval fighting is to be free to go anywhere with every damned thing the Navy possesses.
author: Grenfeld, Captain of the Hammer of Justice

quote: He who seizes the moment, he is the right man.
author: Hawke, Fleet-Admiral

quote: A magnificent ship no doubt, but I would rather have a crew who knew their airlaps from their transons.
author: Rath, Admiral

quote: The Emperor is master of the galaxy, but the captain is master of his ship.

You have committed the ultimate heresy. Not only have you turned your back on the Emperor and stepped from his light, you have profaned his name and almost destroyed everything he has striven to build. You have perverted and twisted the path he has laid for Mankind to tread. As your decrees have stated, there can be no mercy for such a crime, no pity for such a criminal. I renounce your lordship, you walk in the darkness and cannot be allowed to live. Your sentence has been long overdue and it is now time for you to die.
author: Alicia Dominica to High Lord Goge Vandire

quote: Many claim they wish to destroy their enemies. If this were true, most would be compelled to destroy themselves.
author: Abbess Helena the Virtuous

quote: By bolter shell, flamer burst and melta blast, the mutant, the heretic and the traitor alike are cleansed of their sin of existence. So has it been for five millennia, so shall it be unto the end of time.
author: Sister Immaculata
bookSource: Dark Heresy: Blood of Martyrs, pg. 23

quote: Heretics crave the cleansing fire of absolution. They need not fear, for we shall deliver it to them.
author: Canoness Josmane, Order of the Sacred Rose

quote: Once, a Novice Cantus came to me, troubled and uncertain. A slip of a girl, only a few strides down the eternal path leading her to the Golden Throne. She asked me a question. She asked me how we can ever truly understand what faith is. I told her that there is no coin to measure what we feel in our hearts. There are no scales upon which we might weigh the faith of one woman against another. There is only duty and blood. There are only deeds and words. There is only the service to the God-Emperor, and the price that demands from each Sister can only be known by Him. But know that whatever fears must be faced, whatever hardships endured, that price is forever worth its full cost.
author: Sister Katherine Elysius, Daughter of the Emperor (later canonised as Saint Katherine)

quote: You have aided and abetted in the murder of a Sororitas, colluded in the escape of a terrorist witch. You belong to the Sisters of Battle for us to persecute as we see fit. You have no rights, no voice, and no recourse. All that remains to be decided is how you will perish.
author: Sister Celestian Miriya of the Order of Our Martyred Lady
bookSource: Faith and Fire (Novel), ch. Three, pg. 69

quote: Sisters, let us raise our song to the Golden Throne! 11th Movement, 'We Bless the Sinner as He Burns'. All Exorcists target heretic Warhound 17 by 12, commence Adagio and engage!
author: Emillia Nihlus
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two (Second Edition), pg. 233

quote: We are beset by many terrible foes in these dark times, but we walk in the light of the Emperor, and we shall not let a single foe stay us from our duty. We are the Sisters of the great Ecclesiarchy, and we will fight to the bitter end.
author: Canoness Palmiro, Order of the Ebon Chalice

quote: She was an angel, pure as righteous destruction. She laid low the twisted and lifted the hearts of the righteous. At her passing, a million voices cried out her name. Shall we ever again see her like? No, not now, nor ever again...
author: Sister Patricia of the Order Famulous

quote: These heretics refute the Emperor's holy right to rule. Let them argue with the barrel of a gun.
author: Canoness Sabine, Order of Our Martyred Lady

quote:
The absence of faith is the mark of the weak.
The absence of faith is the mark of the heretic.
The absence of faith is the mark of damnation.
author: Ephrael Stern

quote: In any army balance is the key to success. A commander who puts his faith in heavy weaponry alone will be outmanoeuvred. A commander who relies on close combat without support will lose his force to enemy fire. Each element must work in harmony, so that the effectiveness of the army is greater than the sum of its parts.
Do not strike until you are ready to crush the enemy utterly, and then attack without mercy, destroy every vestige of resistance, leave no-one to work against you.
A good general does not lead an army to destruction just because he knows it will follow.
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 2nd Codex), pg. 4

quote: Identify your target. Concentrate your fire on it to the exclusion of all else. When it is destroyed choose another target. That is the way to secure victory!

Always endeavour to fight the enemy on your terms. If you are powerful at close quarters then engage in dense terrain where your advantage will prove greatest. If you are superior at long range then fight the battle at a distance. If you have greater numbers then attack along an extended front. Use reserves to break through when the enemy's overstretched lines collapse. If outnumbered then concentrate your forces so that the enemy can fight only your best troops. No-one ever won a battle who failed to take advantage of his enemy's weakness.
An open battlefield is nothing but a death trap - in war any visible target is a casualty no matter how well protected it may be.
A commander must have the courage to see his plan through, for good or ill. Wars are won or lost when the battle lines are drawn.
If you are strong feign weakness. If weak, pretend strength. Whatever your position, conceal it from the enemy, and he will waste his armies fighting his own phantoms.

If the enemy comes on in a great horde, as Orks are wont to do, then try to direct them into a narrow defile or enclosed space, such that their numbers work against them. Crowded together those at the front will impede those behind, whilst the push from the rear will prevent those at the front from retreating or finding a better path.
bookSource: Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 2nd Codex), pg. 47

quote: Attack the enemy where he is weakest. Where he is strong draw him on until he is trapped. Where he is unsure strike quickly and scatter his forces.
The only justifiable risk is one that can do more harm to the enemy than it can to you. All risks must be calculated in your favour. Otherwise you are fighting for the enemy!

The meaning of victory is not the defeat of your enemy but his utter destruction, to eradicate him from living memory, leaving no remnant of his endeavours, crushing utterly his every achievement and removing from all record his every trace of existence. From that defeat no enemy can ever recover. That is the true meaning of victory.
A warrior's faith in his commander is his best armour and his strongest weapon.

At battle's end, speak the Liturgy in a clear voice. Respect the bravery of the living. Give the Rite of Passage to the fallen. Honour the battle gear of the dead. To do all this with reverence, even when exhausted by battle and weary from the field, is the duty of a Chaplain. It is his burden and satisfaction.
author: Adeptus Astartes, The Book of Faith

quote: Do not fail your Brothers. Though their bodies die, their spirit must return to the Chapter. That is your charge.
author: Medic Credo

quote: The Space Wolves revere the Emperor as the greatest warrior of all time, the only being to have ever bested Leman Russ in hand-to-hand combat. When Space Wolves call upon Russ or the Emperor in battle, it is to witness the deeds of men and to judge the fallen.
author: Meditations upon the Fang

quote: There is only the Emperor, and he is our Shield and Protector.
author: Statement of fact, Second Book of Chantings
bookSource: Warhammer 40,000 Chapter Approved - The Book of the Astronomican, pg. 78

quote: Nothing survives its touch, nothing escapes its grasp. It is a weapon of unspeakable power and unmatched devastation – a horror from a bygone age.
author: Abrahim Kobal, Techmarine of the Salamanders
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Vortex Grenade - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 5 October 2015)

quote: Blessed is the mind too small for doubt.
author: Librarian Isador Akios of the Blood Ravens

quote: Through the destruction of our enemies do we earn our salvation!
author: Librarian Isador Akios of the Blood Ravens

quote: We do not know what our chances of survival are, so we fight as if they were zero. We do not know what we are facing, so we fight as if it was the dark gods themselves. No one will remember us now and we may never be buried beneath Titan, so we will build our own memorial here. The Chapter might lose us and the Imperium might never know we existed, but the Enemy - the Enemy will know. The Enemy will remember. We will hurt it so badly that it will never forget us until the stars burn out and the Emperor vanquishes it at the end of time. When Chaos is dying, its last thought will be of us. That is our memorial - carved into the heart of Chaos. We cannot lose, Grey Knights. We have already won.
author: Justicar Alaric of the Grey Knights

quote: You had to use the whole Trail. Saint Evisser, the cardinals, every single citizen, you had to move them all into position to beat us. Remember that. You put your plan in motion before the Trail even existed, because you knew it would take nothing less. We made you work, daemon. You feared us so much you had to move star systems to make us dance to your tune.
author: Justicar Alaric of the Grey Knights

quote: At Lastrati we gathered every Whirlwind in the Crusade and massed them at the gates of Sogoth. At my order, the entire formation opened fire and the night sky blazed as bright as day. Moments later the city was aflame,its defences shattered and its defenders broken. Inly then did Iorder the Assault squads to attack, and then the battle was truly joined.
author: Ancient Tahncred
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition: War Machines of the Adeptus Astartes, pg. 82

quote: The lives of millions, and the honour of our Chapter, hang in the balance brothers. Failure is not an option.
author: Androcles, Captain of the Star Phantoms
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Vital Mission - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: While the enemies of the Emperor still draw breath, there can be no peace.
author: Captain Gabriel Angelos, Blood Ravens

quote: If your life is given in service to the Emperor, your death shall not be in vain.
author: Chaplain Hauis Argento, Crimson Fists 2nd Company

quote: Victory does not always rest with the big guns: but, if we rest in front of them we shall be lost.
author: Commander Argentius, Silver Skulls

quote: Here we stand and here shall we die, unbroken and unbowed, though the very hand of death itself come for us, we will spit our defiance to the end!
author: Chaplain-Dreadnought Armand Titus, Howling Griffons
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Nine - The Badab War - Part One, pg. 124

quote: Street by street and block by block we’ll sweep them out. There are snipers on the rooftops and the underpass is heavily mined. It’s going to be dangerous, it’s going to be fun.
author: Arn Ironjaw, Wolf Guard
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card "Cityfight - Major Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 7 October 2015)

quote: Victory often rests on the correct weaponry being in the right place and at the right time. Even the most destructive weapons of war are worthless if absent from the battle.
author: Artor Amhrad, Chapter Master of the Astral Knights (deceased)

quote: Treat them with honour, my Brothers. Not because they will bring us victory this day, but because their fate will one day be ours.
author: High Chaplain Astorath of the Blood Angels

quote: Come you aliens, show me what passes for fury amongst your misbegotten kind!
author: Blood Ravens Devastator Sergeant Avitus

quote: We are the Emperor's angels of death, not his angels of mercy.
author: Blood Ravens Devastator Sergeant Avitus

quote: Don't fool yourselves. War is all we are! Killing is all we are good for! The rest is delusion.
author: Blood Ravens Devastator Sergeant Avitus

quote: We are weapons. There is the Emperor, and there is war. Nothing more.
author: Blood Ravens Devastator Sergeant Avitus

quote: Offer the incantation of activation, speak forth the litany of retribution and deliver unto the enemy the wrath of the Omnissiah.
author: Barabel, Praetors of Orpheus Techmarine
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Special Ammunition - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: Fenris breeds heroes like a bar breeds drunks - loud, proud and spoiling for a fight.
author: Grand Master Belial of the Dark Angels

quote: I was on Prospero, brothers. I was there when we burned their heresy from the galaxy. I saw Leman Russ lay waste to their cherished places. I saw Traitors weep from corrupted eyes as we turned their pyramids of glass into barren wasteland. That will not happen here. They were made weak by the knowledge of their treachery. We are made strong by the knowledge of our fidelity. Where Tizca fell, the Aett will stand. Though it may cost the lives of us all, the Aett will stand.
author: Bjorn the Fell-Handed, Venerable Dreadnought of the Space Wolves
bookSource: Battle of the Fang (Novel), ch. Fourteen, pg. 304

quote: God-Emperor? Calling him a god was how all this mess started.
author: Bjorn the Fell-Handed, Venerable Dreadnought of the Space Wolves
bookSource: The Emperor's Gift (Novel), ch. Twenty-Five, pg. 290

quote: We may be few, and our enemies many. Yet so long as there remains one of us still fighting, one who still rages in the name of justice and truth, then by the Allfather, the galaxy shall yet know hope.
author: Ragnar Blackmane, Wolf Lord of the Space Wolves

quote: An open mind is like a fortress with its gates unbarred and unguarded.
author: Blood Ravens Librarian saying

quote: Show me a fortress and I'll show you a ruin.
author: Captain Eddan Bourne, Silver Skulls No. 2 Assault Company

quote: We pray for our brethren who pilot the Dreadnoughts. Though they take new form, their souls, and their weapon mounts, remain pure.
author: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines

quote: Know this, son of Guilliman. The father of our Chapter watches over us always. He knows your soul, your strengths and, aye, even your fears. I share your pain at the loss of Brother-Captain Idaeus, but to dishonour his name with grief is wrong. He gave his life so that his battle-brothers would live and the enemies of the Emperor would be defeated. A warrior can ask for no better death than that. Captain Idaeus was the senior officer, and you were duty bound to follow his orders when they were given. The chain of command must not be broken or we are nothing. Discipline and order are everything on the battlefield and the army that lives by that credo will always triumph.
author: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Nightbringer (Novel) - Ultramarines: The Omnibus, ch. 2, pg. 47

quote: We follow in the footsteps of Guilliman. As it is written in the Codex, so shall it be.
author: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines

quote: You all heard Varro's words. The daemon is vulnerable, exposed, and we have one chance to end this. Right here and right now, the fate of Ultramar is in our hands. You are the best and bravest of your Chapter, and though we may die in these mountains, we will die in service to something greater than blood, something greater than land. We fight for what we know is right. I will lead you in that fight, and all I ask is that you fight like the heroes you are!
author: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines

quote: For Ultramar! CHARGE!
author: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines

quote: Everything has a purpose, Proteus. So the Emperor ordains.
author: Chaplain Carnak, Imperial Fists 3rd Company

quote: The blasphemy of the Tyranids is such that only one solution is acceptable. Extermination. There can only be two sides in a fight - choose carefully, lest you and I find ourselves on different sides.
author: Chaplain Ortan Cassius, Ultramarines Master of Sanctity

quote: We give hope. Ever has it been that the Space Marines are too few to conquer every threat. Yet the truth of our existence and the hope of our intervention steels the hearts of lesser warriors and lends strength to their conviction. They hold out against impossible odds and offer up prayers to the Emperor that the Angels of Death will come. They fight harder, knowing that if they do so we might intervene. Mankind believes our Emperor to be a god, and that is both foolish and blind. Yet they also believe the Adeptus Astartes to be the instrument of His will, and that is not so ignorant. I cannot say whether the Emperor answers prayers thrown up in desperation, but I do know that the Ultramarines reply to calls for aid if it is possible. To not answer that cry for help threatens to shatter something far more precious than ore worlds and hive factories: faith in the Space Marines.
author: Chaplain Ortan Cassius, Ultramarines Master of Sanctity

quote: We must scour them from the stars before they do same to us.
author: Chaplain Ortan Cassius, Ultramarines Master of Sanctity
bookSource: Consumption, #039 card of the "The Great Devourer", expansion to Conquest Card Game, Fantasy Flight Games (last accessed 11 July 2015)

quote: The roar of engines, the recoil of cannons. That is where the true joy of battle lies.
author: Sergeant Antaro Chronus, Ultramarines

quote: Let them hide in their fortress. My crew can use the target practice.
author: Sergeant Antaro Chronus, Ultramarines

quote: What is the terror of death? That we die with our work incomplete. What is the joy of life? To die knowing our task is done. I stand alongside warriors of honour, and the warrior who acts out of honour cannot fail. His duty is honour itself. Even a warrior's death--if it is honourable--is a reward and can be no failure, for it has come through duty. Seek honour as you act, and you will know no fear. A fortress is a living thing: the commander its brain, the walls its bones, the sensors its eyes and ears, the troops its blood, their weapons its fists. If one organ fails, the whole dies. And if the whole dies, no single organ can survive alone. And above all, remember this... for a warrior the only crime is cowardice.
author: Chaplain Judd Clausel, Ultramarines 4th Company

quote: I haven't lost an arm, brother. It's right over there.
author: Captain Alessio Cortez, Crimson Fists

quote: As I bear the colours of my Chapter boldly, so too do these glorious machines. Their flankes caryy our Livery with pride and the scream of their jets proclaims the coming for all our foes to hear.
author: Carab Culln of the Red Scorpions
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition: War Machines of the Adeptus Astartes, pg. 120

quote: If my Marines are ordered to serve alongside these tainted half-animals, they shall do so. But upon their return they shall be quarantined and purified by every means in our Apothecarion.
author: Carab Culln of the Red Scorpions

quote: They are an effective force in their way, and I do not doubt the Emperor's wisdom in allowing tainted subhuman filth to serve Him. But my men shall not be exposed to the corruption of these beasts.
author: Carab Culln of the Red Scorpions

quote: Camouflage is the colour of fear... I have no need to hide from my foes... I have no fear of death. My colours I wear openly, they proclaim louder than any words, "I am proud to live - I am proud to die"
author: Carab Culln of the Red Scorpions

quote: The ethics of booklearning and scholarship I leave to the savants. But for what it's worth, I would have burned it without a second thought.
author: Brother-Captain Cynewolf of the Deathwatch

quote: Shields are holding, power at 44%. Let them spend their impotent wrath.
author: Dac'tyr, Captain of the Salamanders 4th Company
bookSource: Strategy Cards for Planetary Empires expansion game, card Energy Field - Minor Stratagem", (saved archive page, dated February 2011, last accessed 6 October 2015)

quote: Bountiful fate has presented us with the means by which we might repair those wounds upon our souls caused by the weakness of centuries past. It is not only our duty but our right to face the darkness again; to stare into the abyss of the unknown. This time we shall be the cleansing light in the shadow, the burning beacon of righteous war. Restore the honour of the shamed fallen through the death of your foes!
author: Dante, Commander of the Blood Angels
bookSource: White Dwarf September 2016, Space Hulk - Ductways

quote: For eleven hundred years, I have fought and I have seen the darkness in our galaxy. I have seen the vileness of the alien and the heresy of the mutant. I have witnessed the sin of possession. I have seen all the evil that the galaxy harbours, and I have slain all whose presence defiles the Emperor. I have seen what you will see. I have fought what you must fight, and I have slain what you must slay... so fear not and be proud, for we are the sons of Sanguinius, the protectors of Mankind. Aye, we are indeed the Angels of Death.
author: Dante, Commander of the Blood Angels

quote: Let the aspirant's first lesson be obedience, for foolishness is bound to his heart. But the Chapter's discipline and the will of the Chaplain shall drive it from him.
author: Reclusiarch Develain of the Black Templars

quote: We go where we wilt. We slay who we wilt. Let the Emperor judge the righteousness of our deeds.
author: Sergeant D'Kestrel, Raven Guard 1st Company

quote: Give me a hundred Space Marines. Or failing that give me a thousand other troops.
author: Rogal Dorn, Primarch of the Imperial Fists
bookSource: Codex: Space Marines (4th Edition), pg. 2 - Introduction

quote: The Emperor has no like, Loken. There are no gods in this hollow universe to keep him company. So he made us, demi-gods, to stand beside him. I have never quite come to terms with my status. Does that surprise you? I see what I am capable of, and what is expected of me, and I shudder. The mere fact of me frightens me sometimes.
author: Rogal Dorn, Primarch of the Imperial Fists
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 134

quote: Don't be insulted, but there is something very human about you, Loken, for an Astartes.
author: Rogal Dorn, Primarch of the Imperial Fists
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 136

quote: If there is nobility remaining within Konrad's Legion, then it is hidden deeply beneath too many layers of twisted lusts, deviance, and disobedience. Their ways are foolish, ill-considered and a hindrance to the orderly flow of controlled war. The time is coming when the Night Lords must answer for their behaviour and be brought back into the doctrine of Imperial warfare, lest we lose them to their own deviant hungers.
author: Rogal Dorn, Primarch of the Imperial Fists
bookSource: Soul Hunter (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 123

quote: There is no enemy. The foe on the battlefield is merely the manifestation of that which we must overcome. He is doubt, and fear, and despair. Every battle is fought within. Conquer the battlefield that lies inside you, and the enemy disappears like the illusion he is.
author: Rogal Dorn, Primarch of the Imperial Fists

quote: They shall be my finest warriors, these men who give of themselves to me. Like clay I shall mould them, and in the furnace of war forge them. They will be of iron will and steely muscle. In great armour shall I clad them and with the mightiest guns will they be armed. They will be untouched by plague or disease, no sickness will blight them. They will have tactics, strategies and machines so that no foe can best them in battle. They are my bulwark against the Terror. They are the Defenders of Humanity. They are my Space Marines and they shall know no fear.
author: The Emperor of Mankind
bookSource: The Horus Heresy Book One - Betrayal, pg. 26

quote: You may cleave to your courage but that will fail you, look to your weapons but you will find them not enough. Run, fight, hide, pray, cry out or cover - it does not matter, for we are come.
author: Fafnir Rann, Captain of the Imperial Fists Legion and founder of the Executioners Space Marine Chapter
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Ten - The Badab War - Part Two, pg. 84

quote: We face greenskin invasion rimward, Eldar raiding coreward, rebellion trailing and the tendrils of a Hive Fleet incoming spinward. Situation excellent, attacking on all fronts...
author: Captain Ferdina, Lord of the Marches of the Tigers Argent

quote: Kinsmen, we are being tested. We cannot know what madness has overcome Lorgar, we do not know the fate of our brothers and our primarch. But what we do know is duty. Our duty is to hold this approach to the city, to deny it to the enemy. These were Guilliman's last words to us. Meles gave his life in service of that command, and if called, then so shall we.
author: Captain Erikon Gaius, Ultramarines 21st Company
bookSource: Garro: Oath of Moment (Audio Book), Track 4: In The Tunnel

quote: My name is Nathaniel Garro, and I am a Legion of One.
author: Captain Nathaniel Garro, Death Guard
bookSource: Garro: Oath of Moment (Audio Book), Track 3: The Field of Battle

quote: The Emperor's realm must be cleansed of the taint of the xenos and the heretic. We destroy the former by the sword, we shall destroy the latter through faith and the sword.
author: Gerlach, Dreadnought of the Black Templars
bookSource: Saved Archive GW page (dated December 2005, last accessed 13 October 2016)

quote: Yes, I have a damn question... what wars must there be in creation that require warriors like you?
author: Gerhart of the Black Templars

quote: Raise the flag high. Let those degenerates know who comes to claim their lives this day!
author: Sergeant Adar Geronan, Imperial Fists 4th Company

quote: Bravery is stronger than Adamantium. One is the stuff of the soul-forges, the other an illusion of safety created by fools. Adamantium walls cannot keep us out! We have the courage of the Emperor! And in the Emperor's name... ATTACK!! ATTACK!! NO PRISONERS!!
author: Chaplain Gonzago
bookSource: Warhammer 40,000 Compendium, pg. 22, Warhammer Siege, pg. 109

quote: We of the Librarium must be aware of Chaos. Yet we do not ourselves aim to contend with Chaos, unless compelled to.
author: Librarian Franz Grenzstein of the Imperial Fists

quote: Don’t confuse gratitude for a serendipitous event with any cloying compassion towards the author of that event...
author: Librarian Franz Grenzstein of the Imperial Fists

quote: True justice is quite simply the will of the Emperor.
author: Librarian Franz Grenzstein of the Imperial Fists

quote: The Chaos Power known as Tzeentch conceives plans to alter history schemes which are altogether too devious and far-flung for any human being to hope to comprehend.
author: Librarian Franz Grenzstein of the Imperial Fists

quote: It is the way of Fenris. We stay as long as we can. Fight as hard as we can. Kill as much as we can. Only when we can do no more do we move on.
author: Skold Greypelt of the Space Wolves

quote: You ask a lot of questions, Marlin. You know what I think? I think you need another drink.
author: Skold Greypelt of the Space Wolves

quote: Do you ever go into a fight thinking there's no point giving my best, I'll get another chance later? We only ever get one shot, Marlin. Life is one shot. Making it count is all that matters.
author: Skold Greypelt of the Space Wolves

quote: Let a wave of repugnance for the enemy wash over you. Let hatred fill you. Hate is good, for our goal is a Human galaxy. We are called by the Emperor with a sacred duty to conquer it in His name.
author: Chaplain Grimaldus of the Black Templars, hero of Hive Helsreach
bookSource: White Dwarf 311 (US), pg. 25, Assault on Cephian IV

quote: Follow me, Sons of Russ! This night our enemies shall feel the fangs of the Wolf!
author: Logan Grimnar, Great Wolf of the Space Wolves
bookSource: Codex: Space Wolves (5th Edition), Back Cover

quote: Whatever the Emperor's will is, be sure it will find you out.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines

quote: Let them bestride the galaxy like the gods of old, sheltering Mankind from destruction at the hands of an uncaring universe.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines

quote: It is the great irony of the Legiones Astartes: engineered to kill to achieve a victory of peace that they can then be no part of.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Target//Acquisition, ch. 3, pg. 30

quote: Space Marines excel at warfare because they were designed to excel at everything. Each of you will become a leader, a ruler, the master of your world and, because there is no more fighting to be done, you will bend your transhuman talents to governance and culture.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Target//Acquisition, ch. 3, pg. 30

quote: Never wish for danger. Danger needs no help. There is no such thing as fate that can be tempted, but morale is never improved by an active lust for war.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Target//Acquisition, ch. 3, pg. 40

quote: Two things to note there, Sergeant. One is that there is no such thing as a minor detail. Information is victory. One cannot and should not dismiss any data until one is in a position to evaluate its significance, and that only comes with hindsight. So all detail is important until circumstances render it redundant.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Target//Acquisition, ch. 8, pg. 94

quote: My brother, hear me. Warriors of the XVII Legion, hear me. This violence is against the code of the Legiones Astartes and against the will of our father, the Emperor. In the name of the Five Hundred Worlds of Ultramar, I implore you to cease fire and stand down. Open communication with me. Let us speak. Let us settle this. This action is an error of the most tragic kind. Cease fire. I, Roboute Guilliman, give you my solemn pledge that we will deal with each other frankly and fairly if these hostilities can be suspended. I urge you to respond.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), System//Kill, ch. 1, pg. 167

quote: Lorgar of Colchis. You may consider the following. One: I entirely withdraw my previous offer of solemn ceasefire. It is cancelled, and will not be made again, to you or to any other of your motherless bastards. Two: you are no longer any brother of mine. I will find you, I will kill you, and I will hurl your toxic corpse into hell's mouth.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), System//Kill, ch. 3, pg. 195

quote: What does not kill me... is not trying hard enough.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Ushkul//Thu, ch. Two, pg. 348

quote: They shall be pure of heart and strong of body, untainted by doubt and unsullied by self-aggrandisement. They will be bright stars on the firmament of battle, Angels of Death whose shining wings bring swift annihilation to the enemies of Man. So it shall be for a thousand times for a thousand years, unto the very end of eternity and the extinction of mortal flesh.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines

quote: I am the fist, clenched tight in ceramite, smashing with the force of a Legion. I am the blade, awaiting my foe’s flesh, as keen as the Emperor could make me. I am the bolt, fired from afar – fleet and true, an end to all who stand before the Imperium of Man.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines

quote: For the Emperor stands behind his sons as the primarchs behind their captains. It is a captain’s duty to place legionary lives in harm’s way before his own. There is too little glory in the galaxy to go around and officers must be generous in the trust they place in others – for one day such brothers must be captains too.
author: Primarch Roboute Guilliman of the Ultramarines

quote:
We die, though our war is eternal,
We are doomed, but we walk in darkness,
We are forgotten, yet the future is our gift to humanity.'
author: Oath of the Grey Knights Seventh Brotherhood, attributed to its first Grand Master

quote: Fenrisians are taught to value comradeship and loyalty to their tribes from birth. Within the Space Wolves, their loyalty is given to their Wolf Lord and the Company of his followers. As warrior-barbarians they set great store by personal bravery and great deeds, having little but contempt for authority that is bestowed rather than earned through the proven virtues of combat.
author: Colonel Hassar, Cadian 7th

quote: Where the Neophyte sees only the difficulties and the Initiate only the advantages in any great enterprise, the hero sees both.
author: High Marshal Helbrecht of the Black Templars

quote: The Space Wolves have already proven their ability to stave off the most determined attacks on their realm, so overt action is out of the question. However, I believe that it is imperative that they are closely monitored for signs of abomination.
author: Balthazar von Heppel, Ministorum Adept

quote: Of all the Primarchs, the end of Leman Russ is the most mysterious, for he is accounted to have vanished ten thousand years ago. One of the most fundamental of the Space Wolves' tenets is the belief that their Primarch will eventually return for the final battle at the end of the universe.
author: Balthazar von Heppel, Ministorum Adept

quote: A foe without honour is a foe already beaten.
author: Ancient Helveticus, Ultramarines Honour Guard

quote: Guard your tongue, whelp, lest I cut it out. I care not for your moon-touched ramblings, nor for the tales of your grandmother. Mark this well - of the 13th Company we do not speak.
author: Ulfric Hoodclaw of the Space Wolves

quote: The Wolves aren't animals. No beast is bound by honour, nor does it sacrifice itself for others outside its pack.
author: Hyperion of the Grey Knights
bookSource: The Emperor's Gift (Novel), ch. Twenty-Four, pg. 284

quote: The deeds of one bold warrior can alter the course of a battle. I have four such men under my command and our every deed changes the shape of the galaxy.
author: Sergeant Daegon Incursa, Invaders 1st Company

quote: Praise the sun that brings the dawn of our final doom.
author: Saul Invictus, First Captain of the Ultramarines

quote: So it was in the beginning; so ever it shall be.
author: Credo of the Iron Hands

quote:
Only the spirit is pure.
The mind may be swayed, the body may fail.
Only the soul cradles vengeance purely.
Become the weapon of the soul.
author: Principle Lessons of the Iron Hands

quote:
Where the mind hesitates, overcome it.
Where the body fails, replace it.
Aspire to the condition of the Primarch.
Emulate his union with steel.
author: Principle Lessons of the Iron Hands

quote:
Never waver.
Never retreat.
Never doubt.
author: Principle Lessons of the Iron Hands

quote:
The flesh is weak.
The weak shall be purged.
What remains is strength.
author: Principle Lessons of the Iron Hands

quote: As my battle-brothers are clad in armour of Truesilver, so shall they ride to war in gleaming chariots, protected against all harm until the moment of battle is come.
author: Issad, Brother-Captain of the Grey Knights
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two (Second Edition), pg. 204

quote: Problems? Problems? There is no problem I cannot solve with this...
author: Commander Mad Chainsaw Johnson of the White Scars

quote: We have been wounded sorely. Yet still we stand, with fire in our eyes and valour in our hearts. Let them think us beaten. We shall teach them otherwise.
author: Pedro Kantor, Chapter Master of the Crimson Fists

quote: Surround yourself with the greatest warriors at your command, or cower in the deepest and darkest hole you can find. It matters not. I shall take your head for the Great Khan and for the Emperor.
author: Captain Kor'sarro Khan, White Scars 3rd Company, Master of the Hunt

quote: Yes, my lord, you could order the Long Fangs to engage the Orks from that ridge. That's what we did at Karnax 17, and it cost the lives of three entire packs. I advise a direct, frontal assault by the Dreadnoughts, followed by the second wave of the Great Company's kin. If that doesn't smash these greenskins back to the stinking pits of Octavius then I'll answer to the Allfather in person.
author: Ancient Kryll, Dreadnought of the Space Wolves
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition: War Machines of the Adeptus Astartes, pg. 164

quote: I, for one, was bloody glad to see the Snakes power in. Beautiful bastards, they are. I owe them my life and my soul.
author: Major Goff Kurtane, 9th Radial Sarpoy Regiment
bookSource: The Sabbat Worlds Crusade (Background Book), pg. 24

quote: We shall never rest while a single renegade draws breath. Let them fear our names.
author: Captain Leitz of the Exorcists

quote: Brother... kinsman... every time the death comes closer, but still I am rejected. Do you know why? Will you not tell me? Death took you! Why not me? WHY NOT ME?!
author: Captain Garviel Loken of the Luna Wolves
bookSource: Garro: Legion of One (Audio Book), Track: Cerberus Alone

quote: I have travelled far and seen much. Yet nothing warms my heart so much as the sight of a gun so massive that its fury makes the very world tremble.
author: Captain Darnath Lysander, Imperial Fists 1st Company

quote: My kind were created to feel no fear, but we understand it. We were all once men who felt fear as does anyone else, and we must know it because it is a weapon we wield.
author: Captain Darnath Lysander, Imperial Fists 1st Company

quote: If they are so eager to die, and they will not heed the advice of their superiors, then let them rush headlong into the jaws of the lion. We can only hope some of them get caught in its throat.
author: Lord Solar Macharius

quote: But without a purpose, an Astartes is nothing. A warrior without a war is no warrior at all.
author: Malcador the Sigillite
bookSource: Garro: Oath of Moment (Audio Book), Track 5: Flashback

quote: Make war and move on, and again, and again, until nothing breathes which stands against us. All else is sophistry and pretty lies.
author: Ferrus Manus, Primarch of the Iron Hands
bookSource: The Horus Heresy Book Two - Massacre, pg. 68

quote: The duty of the Medic, my Brethren, is a sacred one. We embody the Emperor's divine will and his holy purpose. We bring death and we bring life. Let those true to Humanity's cause give thanks for our work. Let the impure bow down before our swords!
author: Surgeon-Commander Grigor Markhava

quote: I trust these automata-weapons far more than any mortal ally. Their machine spirits have served our Chapter faithfully for centuries, and are sure to stand where mortal hearts succumb to fear. Just like us, they know no fear.
author: Iron Thane Mazos Dhule of the Sons of Medusa
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition, pg. 198

quote: Faith is purest when it is unquestioning.
author: Chaplain Mikelus of the Blood Ravens

quote: Pain now! Reward in the afterlife.
author: Chaplain Mikelus of the Blood Ravens

quote: I ask myself what it means to be one of the Dark Angels. Is it to hunt the Fallen, chasing shadows through the dark places of the galaxy? Is it to pursue our quest at any expense, forgoing all other oaths and duties? Is it to lie, to hide and to plot so that others will never know of our shame? Is it to keep our own brethren unacquainted with the truth of our past, the legacy we all share in? Or ist it to be a Space Marine? Is it to follow the path laid down by the Emperor and Lion El'Johnson at the founding of this great Imperium of man? To protect mankind, to purge the alien, cleanse the unclean?
author: Interrogator-Chaplain Boreas of the Dark Angels

quote: As our bodies are armoured with Adamantium, our souls are protected with our loyalty. As our bolters are charged with death for the Emperor's enemies, our thoughts are charged with his wisdom. As our ranks advance, so does our devotion, for are we not Marines? Are we not the chosen of the Emperor, his loyal servants unto death?
author: Chaplain Fergas Nils
bookSource: Warhammer 40,000 Compendium, pg. 21; Warhammer 40,000 5th Edition Rulebook, pg. 20

quote: If you know no fear, do you also not know awe? Surprise? Majesty? Have you not seen things so bizarre they left you speechless? Shocked you? Unnerved you even?
author: Mersadie Oliton, Remembrancer
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part Two, ch. Nine, pg. 172

quote: One warrior usually suffices.
author: Priad of the Iron Snakes
bookSource: Brothers of the Snake (Novel), Part One - XII

quote: "Mingle"? What in the Emperor's name does that mean?
author: Priad of the Iron Snakes
bookSource: Brothers of the Snake (Novel), Part Six - II, pg. 171

quote: Everything has a purpose. The Emperor ordains it so. You may corrupt the souls of men. But I am steel! I am doom! I march for Macragge, and I know no fear!
author: Brother Proteus, Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: Oh, Proteus. You novices are all alike. And I'm the one who has to put you back together. It isn't combat I resent, Brother. It's the thirst for glory that gets men cut to ribbons.
author: Apothecary Pythol, Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: Death will find you soon enough. War is not about glory. War is about victory!
author: Apothecary Pythol, Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: May the Emperor bless and protect this sacred legacy, so that the strength of these brave warriors may live on in Ultramarines yet unborn, for the abiding honour of our fortress home, Macragge, in the name of the Chapter and the Primarch, to whom we owe all.
author: Apothecary Pythol, Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: We attack without warning, mercy or hesitation. Let the enemies of Mankind know that we will purge every last one of them, and let them shake in fear.
author: Pugilis, Commander of the Iron Knights
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition: War Machines of the Adeptus Astartes, pg. 10

quote: I'll not be known as a Son of Horus again, mark that well, lad.
author: Captain Iacton Qruze of the Luna Wolves
bookSource: The Flight of the Eisenstein (Novel), ch. Nine, pg. 229

quote: This place was built to destroy something precious to us, something each of us shares, no matter which Primarch or Chapter we call our own. I speak of brotherhood. Bile has isolated us, severed all but the most cursory of contacts. He sows distrust and suspicion, wears you down with the slow grind of mindless days and tormented nights. The bastard wants you to believe you are forgotten. He lies. I am here to tell you that he lies and lies! Look within yourselves, brothers, and you will understand. You have been waiting for this day, even if you did not know it. This day, when you are reminded of who you are. My purpose here is the same as yours, to serve the God-Emperor and Holy Terra! Know that each of you is the harbinger of your own freedom! I say to you all that this day, we are not Blood Angels, Doom Eagles, Space Wolves, Taurans, Salamanders, Crimson Fists... We are one great legion, one heart and one mind! We are the Adeptus Astartes, the Space Marines, the war gods and terrible swift sword of our Emperor! We are His will, and we have always been so!
author: Sergeant Rafen of the Blood Angels

quote: It is the duty of the Initiate to pass on what he has learned of the craft of death and thus pave the way for the heroes of the future.
author: Initiate Rammius of the Black Templars

quote: The Emperor commands us. Dorn guides us. Honour shields us. Fear our name, for it is vengeance.
author: Rhetoricus of the Imperial Fists

quote: Listen closely Brothers, for my life's breath is all but spent. There shall come a time far from now when our chapter itself is dying, even as I am now dying. Then my children, I shall list'n for your call from whatever realms of death hold me, and come I shall no-matter what laws of life and death forbid. At the end I will be there. For the final battle. For the Wolftime.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: You strive for victory. That is obvious. What may be less obvious is the nature of victory. There are circumstances in which you can destroy the enemy utterly, without loss to your own forces, and yet the victory may be his. In all situations, you must first decide on the nature of victory, and then take steps to secure it. Avoid the instinct of fight first and think later.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: A fortress circumvented ceases to be an obstacle. A fortress destroyed ceases to be a threat. Do not forget the difference.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: A fortress is built with blood and toil. Only by blood and toil may it be taken.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: Beat your thoughts to the mould of your will.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: There are those who undervalue the Penal Battalions. But they should consider this: should a man who has wronged the Emperor be allowed to wrong Him further? For each man executed is a man who can no longer serve, and to fail in service to the Emperor is the greatest of sins
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: Do not underestimate the Squats. They survived for millennia cut off from the Imperium and assailed from all sides. Their determination and resilience is an example to all.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: Harden your soul against decadence. But do not despise it, for the soft appearance of the decadent may be deceptive. One need only consider the Harlequin dancers of the Eldar to see the truth of this proposition.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: Here I am and here shall I die.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves

quote: Arm the bastards and they might win a few bloody worlds for us in between verses.
author: Primarch Leman Russ of the Space Wolves
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 3, pg. 46

quote: My son... step back, if you can. Step back from the abyss and return to us. I will save you. This is my fault. I am to blame. But I will amend this, if you help me. Will you help me, Alotros?
author: Sanguinius, Primarch of the Blood Angels Legion
bookSource: Fear to Tread (Novel), Prologue: Melchior, pg. 37

quote: It cries out for blood. And there is never enough.
author: Sanguinius, Primarch of the Blood Angels Legion
bookSource: Fear to Tread (Novel), Prologue: Melchior, pg. 42

quote: I made a vow, Kano. I will see it to its bloody end. There may come a day, and sooner than we might wish, when you...when my sons will have to go on without me.
author: Sanguinius, Primarch of the Blood Angels Legion

quote: There are more things in the darkness than man can ever count.
author: Sanguinius, Primarch of the Blood Angels Legion

quote: We are disorder, that is true. But that is what we were made to be. The wild and the random. If each Successor embodies the traits of The Great Angel, then that is what the Flesh Tearers are, just as the Blood Swords are his martial prowess, the Sanguine his secrecy, the Flesh Eaters his carnivore's fangs! But the Blood Angels are the melding of all of those things, and that is why I will always envy you, cousin.
author: Gabriel Seth, Chapter Master of the Flesh Tearers

quote: For he today that sheds his blood with me shall be my battle-brother eternal.
author: Gabriel Seth, Chapter Master of the Flesh Tearers

quote: In the darkness all men are equal, save those that embrace it.
author: Kayvaan Shrike, Shadow Captain of the Raven Guard 3rd Company

quote: We are coming. Look to the skies for your salvation.
author: Kayvaan Shrike, Shadow Captain of the Raven Guard 3rd Company

quote: Wherever you tread, tread lightly. We are closer than you think, and our blades are sharp.
author: Kayvaan Shrike, Shadow Captain of the Raven Guard 3rd Company

quote: We are the slayers of kings, the destroyers of worlds, bringers of ruination and death in all its forms. These things we do in the name of the Emperor and in the defense of Mankind. Let none stay our wrath.
author: Cato Sicarius, Captain of the Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: Brothers! War calls you. Will you answer?
author: Cato Sicarius, Captain of the Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: Slay the beast and the horde will die.
author: Cato Sicarius, Captain of the Ultramarines 2nd Company

quote: The more we spread the more we find. World after world. New worlds to conquer. Space is limitless, and so is our appetite to master it.
author: Sigismund, First Captain of the Imperial Fists Legion and first High Marshal of the Black Templars
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 131

quote: We will spend our lives fighting to secure this Imperium, and then I fear we will spend the rest of our days fighting to keep it intact. There is such involving darkness amongst the stars. Even when the Imperium is complete, there will be no peace. We will be obliged to fight on to preserve what we have fought to establish. Peace is a vain wish. Our crusade may one day adopt another name, but it will never truly end. In the far future, there will be only war.
author: Sigismund, First Captain of the Imperial Fists Legion and first High Marshal of the Black Templars
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 132

quote: Nothing worthwhile is done without challenge, best to overcome it before plans are enacted.
author: Sigismund, First Captain of the Imperial Fists Legion and first High Marshal of the Black Templars

quote: Many great legends lived before Brother Rammius, but most are unmourned and are consigned to unremembered history. Such shall not be the Rammius' fate, for he lives on in glory and, with our ministrations, shall do so for a thousand years and more.
author: Techmarine Simagus of the Black Templars

quote: We ride upon the wings of storm. What hope of escape can our foes have?
author: Spiccare, Sergeant of the Blood Angels 1st Company
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition, pg. 26

quote: I believe in three tenets of battle - firepower, firepower, and more firepower. Should the Omnissiah have wished otherwise, he would not have provided me with such a mighty tool as the Razorback. I long for the day in which my entire Chapter can ride to war in transports such as these, vehicles whose rage can be given voice through their sanctified armament.
author: Kardan Stronos, Chapter Master of the Iron Hands

quote: Those of the xenos that our Predators do not crush beheanth their armoured tread, we shall strike down ourselves with avenging bolt and righteous blade. Onward Crimson Fists, ever onward!
author: Brother-Captain Telamon, Crimson Fists
bookSource: Imperial Armour Volume Two - Second Edition: War Machines of the Adeptus Astartes, pg. 60

quote: Forget all your preconceptions of war, of battle-lines clashing in the churned ground. Your mission is to attack before the foe even realises that the war has begun, to strike hard at those vital weaknesses that all armies possess, but that no commander will admit to. Under my tutelage you will learn how to seek out such fragilities and smite them with every weapon at your disposal. Master these duties and I will have nothing more to teach, and you will truly be a Space Marine.
author: Sergeant Torias Telion, Ultramarines 10th Company

quote:
Each path must be chosen with care,
Lest disaster swallow us whole.
author: Varro Tigurius, Chief Librarian of the Ultramarines

quote: Never before or since have I seen fighting such as I witnessed when that host fell upon the Orks. Seizing the moment, I regrouped my Company and led them once more into the fray, yet there was little work for us, for the greenskins lacked stomach for the fight. Soon we secured the great bastion once more and without further loss. Of the dark brotherhood there was no sign.
author: Varro Tigurius, Chief Librarian of the Ultramarines

quote: It cannot be considered a gift, to peer into the Warp and unravel the possibilities of the future that are, that might be, and that must be prevented. Nor can the burden of a weapon, that each of my brothers looks upon with girded revulsion, be called a gift. No, Master, I do not think my psychic prowess a gift... but a tool. Whether by a quirk of fate, or the will of the Emperor, I possess a weapon the like of which can turn the tide, not just in a battle but in the course of history. To withhold it, to flinch from its use or deny it would not just be counter-productive, it would be heresy. But if it is a gift, it is a cruel one.
author: Varro Tigurius, Chief Librarian of the Ultramarines
bookSource: Warlords of the Dark Millennium: Tigurius (Background Book), pg. 3

quote: The answer, always, is the Wolves of Fenris, because they are clinically insane.
author: Captain Tarik Torgaddon, Luna Wolves 2nd Company
bookSource: Horus Rising (Novel), Part One, ch. 6, pg. 132

quote: They believe they are too good for the Codex Astartes, these... these wolf-men? Too good for ten millennia of tested and refined battle wisdom? Then let them fight as savages, I say. Let them fight and die.
author: Captain Nico Trevellias of the White Consuls

quote: Arm yourselves, fools, the enemy are within us!
author: Marine Psyker Troos, presumably White Scars

quote: My sword is at the Emperor's command. I answer to no other man, living or dead.
author: Tu'shan, Chapter Master of the Salamanders

quote:
We march for Macragge!
And we shall know no fear!
author: Ultramarines Battle-chant

quote: To take a town, send a legionary. To take a city, send a squad. To take a world, send a company. To take a culture, send a Chapter.
author: Popular Ultramarines Aphorism
bookSource: Know No Fear (Novel), Target//Acquisition, ch. 3, pg. 40

quote: Come all you Xeno scum and fallen heretics! Come face the one true might of the universe and wither under the Golden Throne's gaze!
author: Chaplain Varnus of the Ultramarines

quote: Hell? There is no such thing, Garro! It's a figment of old idolatry, nothing more. We have no need for a place of horrors beyond death. Horus makes it for us, here, in the real!
author: Macer Varren, Loyalist Captain of the World Eaters
bookSource: Garro: Legion of One (Audio Book), Track 4: The Battlefield

quote: Garro, heed me. We have lost so many of our brethren to this schism, this damned bloody war! A traitor I will kill without hesitation, but we do not speak of a traitor! Our kinsman is lost.
author: Macer Varren, Loyalist Captain of the World Eaters
bookSource: Garro: Legion of One (Audio Book), Track 7: Aftermath

quote: I was not cut out to lead like this, Garro. I am a killer, a meat cutter, not a brood mare struggling to protect a brood of weak and feeble runts! I lead warriors, not common folk!
author: Macer Varren, Loyalist Captain of the World Eaters
bookSource: Garro: Sword of Truth (Audio Book), Disc 2, Track 2: The Daggerline

quote: I can pulp your flesh and snap your bones in less than a second, and without so much as lifting a finger. What is the power of technology compared to that?
author: Chief Librarian Vel'cona of the Salamanders

quote: I have seen my share of death, both honourable and despicable, and yes, I know that war is a brutal, bloody business capable of bringing out the best and the worst in men. This is a harsh, dangerous galaxy, with untold terrors lurking in the dark to devour us, but the minute we turn on our own kind and murder them, we might as well take a blade to our throats.
author: Ultramarines Captain Uriel Ventris
bookSource: The Killing Ground (Novel), ch. Eighteen, pg. 277

quote: Without the Codex Astartes, the Imperium wouldn't have survived the aftermath of the Great Heresy. It binds every one of the thousand Chapters of Space Marines together, and gives us a common cause, a connection to the past and to one another. Every Chapter, whether they acknowledge it or not, owes its very existence to the Codex Astartes.
author: Ultramarines Captain Uriel Ventris

quote: If you can see us, we are dangerous indeed. But that is nothing to the peril you face if you cannot see us, and all you can hear is our laughter.
author: White Scars

quote: It was the Allfather who created Leman Russ, the primogenitor of the Vlka Fenryka, and the Allfather who fashioned the Legion that served under his name. For every Legion he created, there was a purpose. Some were blessed with the power to build, or the skill to administer, or the capacity for stealth. Our gift was different. We were made to destroy. Our whole being is destruction. Such was the will of the Allfather. He made us not to construct empires, but to murder them. We were bred to perform the tasks that no other Legion could, to fight with such extravagance that even our brother warriors would shrink from treachery in the knowledge of what we, the Rout, would do to them.
author: Thar Ariak Hraldir, "Wyrmblade," Wolf Priest of the Space Wolves
bookSource: Battle of the Fang (Novel), ch. Nineteen, pgs. 418-419

quote: A fortress won't stop the Marines. But it may slow them down.
